text.ori_cn: §乾：元亨利贞。
text.man_en: Khien (represents) what is great and originating, penetrating, advantageous, correct and firm.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Qian: Yuanhenglizhen.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Inui: Yuan Hyeri.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Qian: The creative works, hence success.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: Khien（代表）伟大的、起源的、有穿透力的、有利的、正确的和坚定的东西。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 谦（代表）伟大、原始、透彻、有利、正确、坚定。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 乾（代表）伟大和创始，通达，有利，正直和坚韧。

text.ori_cn: 初九：潜龙勿用。
text.man_en: In the first (or lowest) NINE, undivided, (we see its subject as) the dragon lying hid (in the deep). It is not the time for active doing.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The first nine days of the year: the submerged dragon is not to be used.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninth day: Do not use Qianlong.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: First Nine: The dragon remains hidden; do not use it.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在第一个（或最低的）"九 "单元中，（我们看到它的主题是）隐藏（在深海中的）龙。现在不是积极行动的时候。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在第一个（或最低的）九个中，完整的，（我们看到它的主题）龙隐藏在（深处）。现在不是积极行动的时候。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初九，潜龙勿用。

text.ori_cn: 九二：见龙在田利见大人。
text.man_en: In the second NINE, undivided, (we see its subject as) the dragon appearing in the field. It will be advantageous to meet with the great man.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Ninety-two: Seeing the dragon in the field is conducive to seeing the lord.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-two: See the dragon in the field and meet the master.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Ninety-two: Seeing the dragon in the fields, it is beneficial to meet a great person.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在第二九节中，（我们看到它的主题是）龙出现在田野里。与伟人会面将是有利的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在第二个九，完整的，（我们看到它的主题）龙出现在田野里。与伟人会面是有利的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在第二爻，不分的，（我们看到它的主题）龙现于田。与大人见面将会有利。

text.ori_cn: 九三：君子终日乾乾夕惕若厉无咎。
text.man_en: In the third NINE, undivided, (we see its subject as) the superior man active and vigilant all the day, and in the evening still careful and apprehensive. (The position is) dangerous, but there will be no mistake.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine three: a gentleman who spends all his days drying up and being vigilant if he is not to blame.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 93: A gentleman works hard all day long and is vigilant at night.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The nobleman remains diligent and cautious throughout the day; his ceaseless vigilance averts danger and assures he remains blameless.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在第三个 "九 "中，"不分割"，（我们看到它的主题是）上位者整日活跃而警惕，到了晚上仍然小心翼翼、忐忑不安。(位置）危险，但不会出错。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 三九不分，君子日间活跃而警惕，晚上仍小心谨慎。 （这个位置）很危险，但是不会有错误。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九三，君子终日乾乾，夕惕若厉，无咎。

text.ori_cn: 九四：或跃在渊无咎。
text.man_en: In the fourth NINE, undivided, (we see its subject as the dragon looking) as if he were leaping up, but still in the deep. There will be no mistake.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine four: or leaping in the abyss without blame.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-four: There is no fault in jumping into the abyss.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Ninth four: One may leap in the abyss without blame.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在第四九节中，没有分割，（我们看到它的主体是龙的样子）仿佛他正在跃起，但仍在深渊中。不会有错。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在第四个九，不可分割，（我们看到它的主题是龙看起来）好像他正在跳跃，但仍然在深处。不会有任何错误。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九四，九不变，（我们看到它的主题就像）龙似乎要跳跃，但仍在深渊。无咎。

text.ori_cn: 九五：飞龙在天利见大人。
text.man_en: In the fifth NINE, undivided, (we see its subject as) the dragon on the wing in the sky. It will be advantageous to meet with the great man.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine and a half: Flying dragons in the sky are good for meeting adults.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-five: Feilong meets the adults in Tianli.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Ninety-five: The flying dragon is in the sky, it is advantageous to see a great person.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在第五个九宫格中，（我们看到它的主题是）天空中展翅飞翔的巨龙。与伟人相会是有利的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在第五个“九”中，不可分割，（我们看到它的主题是）天空中展翅的龙。与伟人会面是有利的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九五，飞龙在天，利见大人。

text.ori_cn: 上九：亢龙有悔。
text.man_en: In the sixth (or topmost) NINE, undivided, (we see its subject as) the dragon exceeding the proper limits. There will be occasion for repentance.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Upper 9: Hyperactive Dragon.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 9: The dragon has regrets.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Top Nine: The overextended dragon has regrets.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在第六节（或最上一节）"九 "中，（我们看到其主题是）龙超越了适当的界限。将有悔改的机会。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在第六（或最高）九中，未分开，（我们将其主题视为）龙超出了适当的限制。会有悔改的机会。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 上九，飞龙在天，利见大人。

text.ori_cn: 用九：见群龙无首吉。
text.man_en: (The lines of this hexagram are all strong and undivided, as appears from) the use of the number nine. If the host of dragons (thus) appearing were to divest themselves of their heads, there would be good fortune. [The points are a duke's additions]
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Use 9: Seeing a group of dragons without a head is auspicious.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Use nine: It is auspicious to see a group of dragons with no leader.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In the use of the nine: You will see a group of dragons without a leader; this is auspicious.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: (此卦的爻辞都是刚劲有力、不分不散的，这从数字 "九 "的使用中可以看出。如果（这样）出现的群龙能卸下首级，就会有吉祥。[穴为公爵所加］
text.man_en2ggl_cn: （此卦的线条有力且完整，从数字九的使用中可以看出）。若众龙出头，则有吉祥。 【积分是公爵的补充】
text.man_en2gpt_cn: （此卦的六爻皆为阳爻不变，表现为）用九。如果众龙出现时去掉他们的头，将有大吉。[这些点是公爵的增补]

text.ori_cn: §坤：元亨利牝马之贞君子有攸往先迷后得主利西南得朋东北丧朋安贞吉。
text.man_en: Khwan (represents) what is great and originating, penetrating, advantageous, correct and having the firmness of a mare. When the superior man (here intended) has to make any movement, if he take the initiative, he will go astray; if he follow, he will find his (proper) lord. The advantageousness will be seen in his getting friends in the southwest, and losing friends in the northeast. If he rest in correctness and firmness, there will be good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Kun: Yuan Heng Li mare's chastity gentleman has to go to the first fan after the Lord Lee Southwest get friends Northeast loss of friends Anzhen auspicious.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Kun: In the Yuan Dynasty, Henry's female horse is a chastity gentleman. You go to the bewilderment first and then win the victory. You have friends in the southwest, you have friends in the northeast, you have friends in the northeast, An Zhenji.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Kun: Great success follows the perseverance of the mare. The noble one has somewhere to go; initially confused, but later gains the master. Advantageous in the southwest, losing friends in the northeast, peaceful and upright brings good fortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: Khwan（代表）伟大的、起源的、有穿透力的、有利的、正确的和具有母马般坚韧的东西。高人（此处指）要有所作为时，如果主动出击，就会误入歧途；如果跟随，就会找到（合适的）主人。其利在西南得友，东北失友。安于正定，则吉。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 坤（代表）伟大、原始、透彻、有利、正确、具有母马的坚定性。君子有行动时，如果他主动，就会走上歧途；如果他主动，他就会走上歧途；如果他主动，他就会走上歧途。如果他跟随，他就会找到他的（真正的）主人。其有利之处在于，在西南有朋友，在东北失去朋友。如果他安住正确、坚定，就会有好运。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 坤象曰：元亨，利牝马之贞。君子有攸往，先迷后得主。西南得朋，东北丧朋。安贞吉。

text.ori_cn: 初六：履霜坚冰至。
text.man_en: In the first SIX, divided, (we see its subject) treading on hoarfrost. The strong ice will come (by and by).
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The sixth day of the month: the arrival of frost and ice.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The sixth day of the lunar month: The frost arrives.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: First Hexagram: Treading on frost, solid ice will come.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在第一个 "六 "中，"分"，（我们看到它的主题）踩在冰霜上。坚冰将（陆续）来临。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在前六首中，分裂，（我们看到它的主题）踩在白霜上。坚固的冰层将会到来（渐渐地）。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初六，履霜，坚冰至。

text.ori_cn: 六二：直方大不习无不利。
text.man_en: The second SIX, divided, (shows the attribute of) being straight, square, and great. (Its operation), without repeated efforts, will be in every respect advantageous.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Six Two: Straight squares are great not to be learnt without disadvantage.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 62: There will be no disadvantage if you don’t get used to the straight square.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Ninth two: Square and great, it does not habituate, there is no harm.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第二个 "六"，分，（表现出）直、方、大的特性。(它的运行），无需反复努力，就会在各方面都带来好处。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第二六分，直、方、大。 （其运作）不需反复努力，各方面都会有利。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第二爻，象征刚正、方正、伟大。其行动无需重复努力，将在各方面均有利。

text.ori_cn: 六三：含章可贞或从王事无成有终。
text.man_en: The third SIX, divided, (shows its subject) keeping his excellence under restraint, but firmly maintaining it. If he should have occasion to engage in the king's service, though he will not claim the success (for himself), he will bring affairs to a good issue.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Sixth three: containing chapters can be chaste or from the king's affairs without success have an end.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-three: Hanzhang Kezhen or his career as a king will end in failure.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Six in the third place: If one preserves grace, one may be steadfast. Should one undertake the king's affairs, nothing will be accomplished, but there will be an end.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第三个 "六"，"分"，（表明其主体）保持克制，但坚定地维护其卓越。如果他有机会为国王效劳，虽然他不会（为自己）争取成功，但他会把事情办好。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第三个六，分裂，（显示其主题）限制他的卓越，但坚定地维持它。如果他有机会为国王服务，尽管他不会（为自己）声称成功，但他会把事情解决好。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第三爻，六，分裂，（显示其主体）克制其卓越，但坚定地保持它。如果他有机会参与国王的事务，尽管他不会将成功归于自己，他将使事情达成良好的结果。

text.ori_cn: 六四：括囊无咎无誉。
text.man_en: The fourth SIX, divided, (shows the symbol of a sack tied up. There will be no ground for blame or for praise.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: VI.4: Bracket without blame or honour.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-Four: There is no blame or honor for including everything.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Ninth four: Acquiring without blame or praise.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第四个 "六"，分割，（表示捆绑的麻袋。没有责备或赞美的理由。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第四个六，分开，（显示了一个捆绑的麻袋的象征。没有理由责备或赞扬。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 六四，分列，（象征一个捆好的口袋，没有理由受到责备或赞扬。）

text.ori_cn: 六五：黄裳元吉。
text.man_en: The fifth SIX, divided, (shows) the yellow lower garment. There will be great good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Sixty-five: Huangshang Yuanji.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-five: Huang Shang Yuanji.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Nine Five: The yellow garments bring supreme good fortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第五个 SIX，分割，（显示）黄色下装。将有巨大的好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第五六，分，（展示）黄色下衣。将会有很大的福气。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第六爻，分开，显示黄色的下衣。将有大吉。

text.ori_cn: 上六：龙战于野其血玄黄。
text.man_en: The sixth SIX, divided (shows) dragons fighting in the wild. Their blood is purple and yellow.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Previous 6: The dragon fights in the field and its blood is bashed.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 6: The dragon fights in the wild, its blood is black and yellow.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Top line: The dragon fights in the wilderness; its blood is black and yellow.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第六个 SIX，分（显示）龙在野外战斗。它们的血液呈紫色和黄色。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第六六，分龙在野外战斗。他们的血液是紫色和黄色的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第六爻，龙争于野，其血玄黄。

text.ori_cn: 用六：利永贞。
text.man_en: (The lines of this hexagram are all weak and divided, as appears from) the use of the number six. If those (who are thus represented) be perpetually correct and firm, advantage will arise.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Use six: Li Yongzhen.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Use six: Li Yongzhen.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: With the sixth line: There is everlasting truth.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: (此卦的爻辞都是虚弱而分化的，这从数字 "六 "的使用中可以看出。如果（所代表的人）永远正确坚定，就会产生好处。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: （此卦的线条都很弱且分开，从数字六的使用中可以看出）。如果那些人（如此代表的人）永远正确和坚定，优势就会出现。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: (这一卦的各条都是柔弱而分散的，可见于)使用数字六。如果那些(用数字六表示的人)始终保持正确和坚定，就会有利。

text.ori_cn: §屯：元亨利贞勿用有攸往利建侯。
text.man_en: Kun (indicates that in the case which it presupposes) there will be great progress and success, and the advantage will come from being correct and firm. (But) any movement in advance should not be (lightly) undertaken. There will be advantage in appointing feudal princes.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Tuen: Yuan Heng Li Zhen Do not use there is a great way to Li Jian Hou.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Tun: Henry Zhen of the Yuan Dynasty should not use Youyou to gain the advantage of establishing a marquis.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Tun: Yuan Heng Li Zhen, do not use anything to go forth, it is beneficial to establish a marquis.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 坤（表示在它所预设的情况下）将会取得巨大的进步和成功，而优势将来自于正确和坚定。(但）任何提前的行动都不能（轻易）进行。任命封建王侯会有好处。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 坤（表示在它所预设的情况下）将会有很大的进步和成功，并且优势来自于正确和坚定。 （但是）不应（轻易）采取任何提前行动。封建诸侯的任命会有好处。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 坤（表示在它所预设的情况下）将有巨大的进步和成功，利益来自于正确和坚定。（但是）任何前进的行动不应轻易进行。有利于任命封建诸侯。

text.ori_cn: 初九：盘桓利居贞利建侯。
text.man_en: The first NINE, undivided, shows the difficulty (its subject has) in advancing. It will be advantageous for him to abide correct and firm; advantageous (also) to be made a feudal ruler.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: 初九：盘桓利居贞利建侯.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The ninth day of the lunar month: Panhuan Li lived in Zhenli and became a Marquis.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: First Nine: It is beneficial to remain in place and uphold integrity, and advantageous to establish a feudal lord.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第一个 "九"，没有分割，显示了（主体）前进的困难。恪守正直和坚定对他有利；成为封建统治者（也）有利。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 前九个完整的，显示了前进的困难（其主题）。正确而坚定地遵守，对他是有利的；有利于成为封建统治者。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初九，不永所事，小有言，终吉。利贞，利建侯。

text.ori_cn: 六二：屯如邅如乘马班如匪寇婚媾女子贞不字十年乃字。
text.man_en: The second SIX, divided, shows (its subject) distressed and obliged to return; (even) the horses of her chariot (also) seem to be retreating. (But) not by a spoiler (is she assailed), but by one who seeks her to be his wife. The young lady maintains her firm correctness, and declines a union. After ten years she will be united, and have children.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Six two: Tuen like not making progress like riding a horse class like bandits and invaders marriage coitus woman chastity not the word ten years is the word.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-Two: The village is like riding a horse, and the bandits are like bandits. A woman who has been married to a bandit has not been chaste for ten years.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Text 62: Stagnant and hesitant like a stalled horse, ceasing any plundering acts and engaging in marriage. The woman remains chaste and without a match, only to find a match after ten years.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第二个 "六 "被分割开来，显示出（其主体）痛苦不堪，不得不返回；（甚至）她战车上的马匹（也）似乎在后退。(但）不是被破坏者（袭击），而是被想娶她为妻的人。年轻的女士保持着坚定的正确性，拒绝了结合。十年后，她将结合并生儿育女。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第二个“六”，分裂，表明（它的主题）苦恼并被迫返回； （甚至）她战车的马匹（也）似乎正在撤退。 （但是）不是一个剧透者（她被攻击了），而是一个寻求她成为他妻子的人。这位年轻女士坚持自己坚定的正确性，拒绝结合。十年后，她将团聚，并生儿育女。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 六二，忧辱，反复，马得其馀。非敌，乃娶。女子贞不字，十年乃字。

text.ori_cn: 六三：即鹿无虞惟入于林中君子几不如舍往吝。
text.man_en: The third SIX, divided, shows one following the deer without (the guidance of) the forester, and only finding himself in the midst of the forest. The superior man, acquainted with the secret risks, thinks it better to give up the chase. If he went forward, he would regret it.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Sixth three: that the deer is not in danger but into the forest gentleman a few not as good as shed to the stingy.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-three: Even if there is no danger of a deer entering the forest, a gentleman might as well give it up and be stingy.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Sixty-three: When a deer is not wary, it enters the forest; the gentleman ceases to strive against what cannot be overcome and practices restraint, avoiding misfortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第三个 "SIX "被分割开来，显示一个人在没有森林管理员（的指引）的情况下追逐鹿群，结果发现自己身处森林之中。高人深知其中的风险，认为最好放弃追逐。如果他继续前进，他会后悔的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第三个“六”，分开，展示了一个人在没有护林员（指导）的情况下跟随鹿，结果发现自己身处森林之中。君子深知其中的隐秘风险，认为最好放弃追逐。如果他继续前进，他会后悔的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九三，得用被兝，独行于林中。君子知所以隐而止。往则悔。

text.ori_cn: 六四：乘马班如求婚媾往吉无不利。
text.man_en: The fourth SIX, divided, shows (its subject as a lady), the horses of whose chariot appear in retreat. She seeks, however, (the help of) him who seeks her to be his wife. Advance will be fortunate; all will turn out advantageously.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Sixth four: riding on a horse class as if seeking marriage to make a marriage to the auspicious and unfavourable.

text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九五，履行厚待之恩时遇到困难。守正道，小事吉；大事虽守正道，仍有祸患。

text.ori_cn: §需：有孚光亨贞吉利涉大川。
text.man_en: Hsu intimates that, with the sincerity which is declared in it, there will be brilliant success. With firmness there will be good fortune; and it will be advantageous to cross the great stream.

text.man_en2ggl_cn: 最上面的六个被分开，显示其主体进入了洞穴。 （但是）有三个客人来了，没有催促，（帮助他）。如果他恭敬地接受它们，最后就会有好运。

text.ori_cn: §讼：有孚窒惕中吉终凶利见大人不利涉大川。
text.man_en: Sung intimates how, though there is sincerity in one's contention, he will yet meet with opposition and obstruction; but if he cherish an apprehensive caution, there will be good fortune, while, if he must prosecute the contention to the (bitter) end, there will be evil. It will be advantageous to see the great man; it will not be advantageous to cross the great stream.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Litigation: Yufu choked in the middle of the lucky end of the bad good to see the adults unfavourable to wade through the big river.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Litigation: Youfu is wary of good luck and bad luck in the end. Seeing that it is unfavorable for you to get involved in Dachuan.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Lawsuit: With sincerity comes vigilance. It brings good fortune initially but leads to misfortune in the end. It is beneficial to meet a great person but not advantageous to cross a large river.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 宋仁宗说："苟有诚心，必遇阻挠；苟怀忧虑，必获吉祥；苟勉力争辩，必遭祸患。见贤思齐焉，见不贤而内自省也。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 宋氏暗示，虽然有诚意，但仍会遭到反对和阻挠。但如果他怀有忧虑的谨慎，就会有好运，而如果他必须将这场争论进行到底，就会有祸患。有利于见到伟人；渡大流，无益矣。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 讼象征着，一切尽管充满了真诚的争论，但仍会遇到反对和阻碍；然而，如果持有戒慎恐惧之心，便会有好的运气，而若执意进行到底，便会有凶险。见大人吉，涉大川凶。

text.ori_cn: 初六：不永所事小有言终吉。
text.man_en: The first SIX, divided, shows its subject not perpetuating the matter about which (the contention is). He will suffer the small (injury) of being spoken against, but the end will be fortunate.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: First six: not ever thing small have words end auspicious.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixth day of the lunar month: Whatever you do will end well.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: First six: Do not persist in what you do, minor disputes will arise but will ultimately conclude well.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第一个 "六"，分，表明它的主体没有延续（争论的）事情。他将因被人说三道四而遭受小小的（伤害），但最终将是幸运的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 前六个，分开，表明它的主题没有使有关的问题永久化（争论是）。他会遭受一些被人反对的小事（伤害），但结局是幸运的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初六，勿永贞，勿害，终吉。

text.ori_cn: 九二：不克讼归而逋其邑人三百户无眚。
text.man_en: The second NINE, undivided, shows its subject unequal to the contention. If he retire and keep concealed (where) the inhabitants of his city are (only) three hundred families, he will fall into no mistake.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine two: not to return to the litigation and Bu Bu's euphonium 300 households without cataracts.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-two: If the lawsuit cannot be suppressed, the three hundred households in Buqiyi will be left without a trace.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Nine Two: Unable to resolve the dispute, he returns and withdraws with three hundred households of his townspeople without any blame.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第二个 "九 "是不分割的，表明其主体与争论不相称。如果他退避三舍，隐蔽起来，他的城市居民（只有）三百户，他就不会犯错。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第二个九，未分割，表明其主题与争论不相称。如果他退休并隐藏他的城市居民只有三百户，他就不会犯错误。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 六二：不勝其爭，退居三百戶之邑，無災患。

text.ori_cn: 六三：食旧德贞厉终吉或从王事无成。
text.man_en: The third SIX, divided, shows its subject keeping in the old place assigned for his support, and firmly correct. Perilous as the position is, there will be good fortune in the end. Should he perchance engage in the king's business, he will not (claim the merit of) achievement.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Sixth Three: Eating the old virtues of ching-li end auspicious or from the king's affairs without success.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-three: If you eat the old virtues, you will be chaste and strong, and you will end up being lucky, or you may not succeed in your career as a king.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Position Six in the Third Line: Nourishing oneself with old virtues. Persistence brings danger, but in the end, there is good fortune. Engaging in affairs of the king results in no achievement.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第三个 "六 "字被分割开来，显示出它的主人公一直坚守在原来的位置上，坚定地支持着他。虽然处境危险，但最终会有好运。如果他偶然参与国王的事务，他将不会（声称）取得成就。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第三个“六”，分开，表明其主体保持在为他的支持分配的旧位置，并且坚决正确。处境虽然危险，但最终会有好运。如果他可能从事国王的事务，他不会（声称有功绩）。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第三爻，处于分裂状态，表现为其主体留在原有的支持位置上，并且坚定正确。尽管处境危险，但最终会有好运。如果他偶然涉及国王的事务，他不会（要求）功绩。

text.ori_cn: 九四：不克讼复即命渝,安贞吉。
text.man_en: The fourth NINE, undivided, shows its subject unequal to the contention. He returns to (the study of Heaven's) ordinances, changes (his wish to contend), and rests in being firm and correct. There will be good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine-four: If there is no lawsuit, then it is fate, and Anzhen is auspicious.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-four: If the lawsuit cannot be resolved, you will be ordered to Chongqing, An Zhenji.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Nine Four: Unable to contend, return and submit; staying steadfast brings good fortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第四个 "九 "是不分割的，表明其主题与争论不相称。他回到（研究天道），改变（争辩的愿望），安于坚定和正确。将有好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第四个“九”，未分割，表明其主题与争论不相称。复归（天之）命，变（欲争），止于坚正。将会有好运。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初九，不爭，归于天理，改變原有的爭心，持正守信，吉祥如意。

text.ori_cn: 九五：讼元吉。
text.man_en: The fifth NINE, undivided, shows its subject contending;and with great good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine five: litigation yuan ji.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-five: Litigation Yuanji.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Nine in the fifth place means: In the lawsuit, supreme good fortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第五个 "九 "是不分割的，显示了主体的争夺；而且是非常幸运的争夺。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第五个九，不分开，显示了它的主题竞争；并且有很大的好运。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九五，不分，其主题争夺；大吉大利。

text.ori_cn: 上九：或锡之鞶带终朝三褫之。
text.man_en: The topmost NINE, undivided, shows how its subject may have the leathern belt conferred on him (by the sovereign), and thrice it shall be taken from him in a morning.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The last nine: or tin of large belt end of the dynasty three stripped.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 9: Maybe the tin belt will be worn out three times in the end.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: At the top line: He is bestowed with a large belt but loses it thrice before noon.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 最上面的 "九 "是不分割的，它显示了臣民如何获得（君主）授予的皮带，以及如何在一个早晨三次从他手中夺走皮带。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 最上面的九个，不可分割，显示了它的臣民如何获得皮带（由主权者）授予他，并且在一个早晨三次从他手中夺走皮带。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 上九，无咎。君之命，革带与之，三易之于朝。

text.ori_cn: §师：贞丈人吉无咎。
text.man_en: Sze indicates how, in the case which it supposes, with firmness and correctness, and (a leader of) age and experience, there will be good fortune and no error.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Division: chaste abbot ji is not to blame.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Teacher: If you are a loyal father-in-law, you will have no fault.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The divination suggests you will have an auspicious and blameless fortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 斯氏指出，在它所假设的情况下，只要坚定正确，加上（领导者的）年龄和经验，就会有好运，不会出错。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 施表明，在它所设想的情况下，只要坚定正确，加上（领导者）年龄和经验，就会有福气，不会有错误。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 《象》曰：谓其刚正中以行之，乃贤老之言，有庆无咎。

text.ori_cn: 初六：师出以律否臧凶。
text.man_en: The first SIX, divided, shows the host going forth according to the rules (for such a movement). If these be not good, there will be evil.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: 初六：师出以律否臧凶.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: On the sixth day of the lunar month: The teacher comes out and uses the law to prevent Zang Ji.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: First six: When an army goes forth in good order, there will be misfortune if there are doubts about its conduct.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第一个 "SIX "被分割开来，显示主机按照（这种运动的）规则前进。如果这些规则不好，就会产生邪恶。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 前六，分开，显示主人按照规则前进（对于这样的运动）。如果这些都不是善，就会有恶。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初六，先取遵循规矩的行动。如果这些规矩不合理，必有凶险。

text.ori_cn: 九二：在师中吉无咎王三锡命。
text.man_en: The second NINE, undivided, shows (the leader) in the midst of the host. There will be good fortune and no error. The king has thrice conveyed to him the orders (of his favor).
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine two: in the division in the auspicious no blame Wang San Xizhi.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-two: In the division, Ji Wujiu Wang Sanxi Ming.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Line 2 of Hexagram 7: Auspiciousness and no blame in the army. The king thrice bestows orders.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第二个 "九 "是不分割的，显示（领导者）在主人中间。吉祥如意，万无一失。国王三次向他传达（他的恩惠）命令。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第二个九，未分开，显示（领导者）在主持人中间。会有好运，不会有错误。国王三次向他传达了（对他有利的）命令。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 六二，不变，看到（领导者）在队伍中间。有福而无错。国王三次传达给他（他的恩惠）的命令。

text.ori_cn: 六三：师或舆尸凶。
text.man_en: The third SIX, divided, shows how the host may, possibly, have many inefficient leaders. There will be evil.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Sixth three: the division or the carriage of a corpse is bad.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-three: The teacher or the corpse is inauspicious.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Sixty-Three: If the troops or the carriage carry a corpse, it is ominous.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第三个 "SIX"，即 "分裂"，表明东道主可能会有许多效率低下的领导人。会有邪恶。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第三个“六”，分裂，表明东道主可能有许多低效的领导者。会有邪恶。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初六，分散，君主可能会有很多无能的领导。将会有不幸。

text.ori_cn: 六四：师左次无咎。
text.man_en: The fourth SIX, divided, shows the host in retreat. There is no error.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: VI.4: The division left the second without blame.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-Four: Master Zuo has no fault.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Six Four: There is no blame in following a different teacher.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第四个 "SIX "被分割，显示东道主正在撤退。没有错误。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第四个“六”，分开，显示主人正在撤退。没有错误。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第四爻，分裂象，有退避之象，无咎。

text.ori_cn: 六五：田有禽利执言无咎长子帅师弟子舆尸贞凶。
text.man_en: The fifth SIX, divided, shows birds in the fields, which it will be advantageous to seize (and destroy). In that case there will be no error. If the oldest son leads the host, and younger men (idly occupy offices assigned to them), however firm and correct he may be, there will be evil.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Sixty-five: the field has fowls and the fowl are good at keeping their words without blame, the eldest son is a handsome teacher and the disciple carries the corpse in a chaste manner.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-Five: Tian Youqinli insists on saying that there is no fault. The eldest son is handsome and his disciple is dead.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Sixty-five: There are birds in the field, it is beneficial to speak up, no blame. The eldest son leads the soldiers, the younger son drives the vehicle carrying the corpses, it will be ominous if they persist.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第五个 "SIX"（分割）显示的是田野里的鸟，抓住（并消灭）这些鸟是有利的。这样就不会出错。如果大儿子领导主人，而小儿子（无所事事地占据分配给他们的职位），无论他多么坚定和正确，都会出现错误。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第五个“六”，分开，显示了田野里的鸟类，这将是有利的抓住（和摧毁）。这样的话就不会出现错误了。如果长子统领军队，而年轻的男子（无所事事地担任分配给他们的职务），无论他多么坚定和正确，都会有邪恶。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第六爻，爻辞显示田野中的鸟类，捕捉并消灭将会有利。这种情况下无过。如果长子领兵作战，而年轻人虚占他们分配到的职位，即使他再坚定正确，也将会有祸患。

text.ori_cn: 上六：大君有命开国承家小人勿用。
text.man_en: The topmost SIX, divided, shows the great ruler delivering his charges, (appointing some) to be rulers of states, and others to undertake the headship of clans; but small men should not be employed (in such positions).
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: On the sixth: the great ruler has the order to open the country to inherit the family small people do not use.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 6: The great king has the order to found the country and inherit the family, so the villain should not use it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Top Six: When a great ruler commands to establish the nation and inherit the family, do not employ petty people.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 最上面的 "六 "字被分割开来，显示的是伟大的统治者交付他的任务，（任命）一些人成为国家的统治者，另一些人则担任氏族的首领；但不应聘用小人物（担任此类职务）。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 最上面的六位，分开，显示伟大的统治者交付他的职责，（任命一些人）为国家的统治者，而其他人则担任氏族的首领；但不应该雇用身材矮小的人（担任此类职位）。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 上九，分裂，显示出伟大的统治者正在发布命令，（任命一些人）为国家的统治者，另一些人负责家族的首脑；但不应任用无能之人担任此类职位。

text.ori_cn: §比：吉原筮元永贞无咎不宁方来后夫凶。
text.man_en: Pi indicates that (under the conditions which it supposes) there is good fortune. But let (the principal party intended in it) reexamine himself, (as if) by divination, whether his virtue be great, unintermitting, and firm. If it be so, there will be no error. Those who have not rest will then come to him; and with those who are (too) late in coming it will be ill.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Than: Ji original divination Yuan Yongzhen no blame not Ningfang come after the husband is fierce.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Comparison: Yoshihara Yuan Nagazada has no fault and is uneasy, but her husband is evil.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Comparison: Jiyuan divination, Yuan Yongzhen, no misfortune; remaining unsettled, misfortune will come later.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 貔貅表示（在它假设的条件下）有好运。但让（其中的主要当事人）重新审视自己，（就像）通过占卜一样，看看自己的德行是否伟大、无私和坚定。如果是这样，就不会出错。那些没有休息的人就会来找他；而那些（来得）太迟的人就会遭殃。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: Pi 表明（在它假定的条件下）有好运。但让（主要当事人）重新审视一下自己，（仿佛）用占卜的方式，看看他的德行是否伟大、不断、坚定。如果是这样的话，就不会有错误了。那些没有安息的人就会到他那里去；对于那些来得太晚的人来说，就会生病。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 睽示(在其假定的条件下)有吉祥。但让(其中主要的当事人)重新审视自己，(就好像)通过占卜，看看他的德行是否伟大、不断且坚定。如果是这样，就不会有错误。那些没有安宁的人就会来找他；而对于那些来得(太)晚的人将会是不利的。

text.ori_cn: 初六：有孚比之无咎有孚盈缶终来有他吉。
text.man_en: The first SIX, divided, shows its subject seeking by his sincerity to win the attachment of his object. There will be no error. Let (the breast) be full of sincerity as an earthenware vessel is of its contents, and it will in the end bring other advantages.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: 初六：有孚比之无咎有孚盈缶终来有他吉。
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixth day of the lunar month: There is nothing wrong with Fu, and there will be good fortune in the end.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Initial Six: With sincerity and trust, there is no blame. With confidence, he fills the vessel, in the end, something good will come.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第一个 "SIX"（分割）表明其主体以其诚意赢得其对象的依恋。这样就不会出错。让（乳房）充满诚意，就像陶器充满其内容物一样，最终会带来其他好处。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 前六，分开，表明其主体寻求通过他的诚意来赢得他的对象的依恋。不会有错误。让（胸）充满真诚，就像陶器充满其内容一样，最终还会带来其他好处。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初六，分爻，得其象，诚信求之，必无咎。若诚满如瓦器之盛，用将来吉。

text.ori_cn: 六二：比之自内贞吉。
text.man_en: In the second SIX, divided, we see the movement towards union and attachment proceeding from the inward (mind). With firm correctness there will be good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Six two: than the self within the chaste and auspicious.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-two: Compared with Zi Nei Zhenji.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Hexagram 62, line 2: Comparison from within, rectitude brings good fortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在第二个 "SIX "中，我们看到的是由内而外（心灵）的结合与依恋。只要坚定正确，就会有好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在第二个六分，我们看到从内在（心智）出发走向联合和依恋的运动。坚定正确就会有好运。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在第二爻，分裂中，我们看到从内心（心智）开始朝向团结和依附的运动。有坚定的正直会带来好运。

text.ori_cn: 六三：比之匪人。
text.man_en: In the third SIX, divided, we see its subject seeking for union with such as ought not to be associated with.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: VI.3: Than the bandits.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-three: Compared with bandits.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Line 63: To compare you to those who are not genuine.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在第三个 "六"（分裂）中，我们看到它的主体在寻求与那些不应该有联系的人结合。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在第三个六，分裂中，我们看到它的主体寻求与不应该关联的人的结合。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在第六卦的第三爻，我们看到其主体寻求与不应合作的人联合。

text.ori_cn: 六四：外比之贞吉。
text.man_en: In the fourth SIX, divided, we see its subject seeking for union with the one beyond himself. With firm correctness there will be good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: VI.4: The chastity of the outer ratio is auspicious.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-Four: External comparison of chastity and auspiciousness.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Hexagram 64, Line 4: Outwardly, there is stability and good fortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在第四个 "六 "中，我们看到它的主体正在寻求与超越自我者的结合。只要坚定正确，就会有好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在第四个六，分裂，我们看到它的主题寻求与超越他自己的结合。坚定正确就会有好运。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在第四爻，离开之后，我们看到他寻求与超越自身的事物结合。只要坚定不移地保持正确，就会有好的运势。

text.ori_cn: 九五：显比王用三驱失前禽邑人不诫吉。
text.man_en: The fifth NINE, undivided, affords the most illustrious instance of seeking union and attachment. (We seem to see in it) the king urging his pursuit of the game (only) in three directions, and allowing the escape of all the animals before him, while the people of his towns do not warn one another (to prevent it). There will be good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine and five: The king of Hsien Bi used the three drives to lose the former bird Euphrasia not to admonish the auspicious.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-five: King Xianbi used three methods to drive away the people in Qinyi before he was lost.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The third line, Nine: The noble one endeavors but loses the game, yet the community remains unflustered, proving auspicious.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第五个 "九 "是不分割的，它提供了寻求联合和依恋的最杰出的例子。(我们似乎可以从中看到）国王（只）从三个方向追赶猎物，让所有的动物在他面前逃走，而他的城镇里的人们却没有互相提醒（阻止）。会有好运的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第五个九，不可分割，提供了寻求结合和依恋的最杰出的例子。 （我们似乎在其中看到）国王敦促他（仅）从三个方向追击这场比赛，并允许他面前的所有动物逃脱，而他的城镇的人们却没有互相警告（以阻止这一情况） 。将会有好运。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九五，求合附之最显著的例子。（我们似乎看到）国王只追赶三个方向的猎物，而放走所有其他在他面前的动物，同时他的城镇居民也不互相警示（以防它）。会有好运。

text.ori_cn: 上六：比之无首凶。
text.man_en: In the topmost SIX, divided, we see one seeking union and attachment without having taken the first step (to such an end). There will be evil.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Upper 6: Bi's without a head is bad.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixth chapter: It’s worse than having no head.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Top six: Associating without a leader brings misfortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在最上面的 "SIX"（分裂）中，我们看到的是一个人在没有迈出第一步的情况下寻求结合和依附。这就是邪恶。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在最上面的六个分裂中，我们看到一个人寻求联合和依恋，而没有迈出第一步（达到这样的目的）。会有邪恶。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 上九，先取结合相附而未先出，其凶。

text.ori_cn: §小畜：亨密云不雨自我西郊。
text.man_en: Hsiao Khu indicates that (under its conditions) there will be progress and success. (We see) dense clouds, but no rain coming from our borders in the west.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Small Animal: Hen Dense Clouds Not Raining Self Western Suburbs.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Little Animal: The clouds in Hemi are not raining, and I am in the western suburbs.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Lesser Accumulation: Success, dense clouds without rain are seen from my western outskirts.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 小丘表示（在其条件下）将取得进展和成功。(我们看到）乌云密布，但西边的边境没有降雨。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 小胡表示，（在它的条件下）将会有进步和成功。 （我们看到）浓密的云层，但我们西部边境没有下雨。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 小畜象曰：(在其条件下)会有进步和成功。(我们看到)浓云，但从我们西边的边界没有雨来。

text.ori_cn: 初九：复自道何其咎吉。
text.man_en: The first NINE, undivided, shows its subject returning and pursuing his own course. What mistake should he fall into?” There will be good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: 初九：复自道何其咎吉。
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninth day of the lunar month: What a blessing to return to one's own path.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: First Nine: Returning to the path brings neither fault nor misfortune, only good fortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第一个九宫格，没有分割，显示了它的主题返回并追求自己的方向。他会陷入什么误区呢？会有好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 前九个完整的，展示了它的主题回归并追求他自己的路线。他应该犯什么错误呢？”将会有好运。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初九，潜龙勿用。何咎？吉。

text.ori_cn: 九二：牵复吉。
text.man_en: The second NINE, undivided, shows its subject, by the attraction (of the former line), returning (to the proper course). There will be good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Ninety-two: draw back to the auspicious.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-two: lead to recovery.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Nine in the second place means: Pulling back brings good fortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第二个 "9 "是不分割的，表明其主题受到（前一条线的）吸引，回到了（正确的方向）。会有好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第二个九，完整地，通过（前一行）的吸引力，返回（到正确的路线）来显示它的主题。将会有好运。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初九，潜龙勿用。

text.ori_cn: 九三：舆说辐夫妻反目。
text.man_en: The third NINE, undivided, suggests the idea of a carriage, the strap beneath which has been removed, or of a husband and wife looking on each other with averted eyes.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Ninety-three: public opinion says that the spokesman and his wife have turned against each other.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-three: Public opinion spreads that the couple turns against each other.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Ninety-three: When the wheels are out of alignment, even couples turn against each other.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第三个 "9 "是不分割的，让人联想到一辆马车，马车下面的带子被卸掉了，或者夫妻二人互相凝视着对方。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第三个“九”是完整的，暗示着一辆马车的想法，马车下面的带子已被拆除，或者一对丈夫和妻子用别开的目光看着对方。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九三，无妄之灾，如车辐之脱或如夫妇相视而目不相接。

text.ori_cn: 六四：有孚血去惕出无咎。
text.man_en: The fourth SIX, divided, shows its subject possessed of sincerity. The danger of bloodshed is thereby averted and his (ground for) apprehension dismissed. There will be no mistake.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Six Four: There is no blame for the blood going to Tigress.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-four: If you have blood, you will be vigilant and there will be no blame.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Sixty-four: If sincerity prevails, bloodshed can be avoided and fear dispelled, resulting in no misfortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第四个 "SIX "被分割开来，这表明它的主体是真诚的。这样就避免了流血的危险，消除了他（的）忧虑。不会有任何错误。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第四个“六”，分开，显示其主题具有诚意。由此避免了流血的危险，并消除了对他的逮捕理由。不会有任何错误。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第四爻，初九，其本质是真诚。这避免了流血的危险，他的担忧因此消除。不再有错误。

text.ori_cn: 九五：有孚挛如富以其邻。
text.man_en: The fifth NINE, undivided, shows its subject possessed of sincerity, and drawing others to unite with him. Rich in resources, he employs his neighbors (in the same cause with himself).
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine and a half: There is a contraction as rich as its neighbours.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-five: There is wealth and wealth in the neighborhood.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Ninety-five: With sincerity and perseverance, one will prosper alongside their neighbors.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第五个 "九 "是不分割的，它显示了主人公的真诚，并吸引其他人与他联合。他有丰富的资源，他雇用他的邻居（与他自己从事同样的事业）。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第五九，不分，显示其主体有诚意，并吸引他人与他联合。他资源丰富，雇用邻居（与他自己的目的相同）。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九五，九不变，显现其人真诚，吸引他人与其联合。资源丰富，他用他的邻居（与他同样的事业）。

text.ori_cn: 上九：既雨既处尚德载妇贞厉月几望君子征凶。
text.man_en: The topmost NINE, undivided, shows how the rain has fallen, and the (onward progress) is stayed; (so) must we value the full accumulation of the virtue (represented by the upper trigram). But a wife (exercising restraint), however firm and correct she may be, is in a position of peril, (and like) the moon approaching to the full. If the superior man prosecute his measures (in such circumstances), there will be evil.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: On the ninth: both the rain both the place Shangde Zai women chastity months several hope that the gentleman levied murder.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 9: It’s raining and the place is virtuous. The wife is chaste and fierce. The moon is looking at the gentleman to ward off misfortune.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Sixth Nine: When rain settles and virtue is still upheld, the presence of a steadfast woman is inauspicious. Approaching the middle of the month, if the noble man ventures forth, it is ominous.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 最上面的九，没有分割，显示了雨是如何落下的，（前进）是如何停止的；（所以）我们必须重视（上卦所代表的）美德的充分积累。而妻子（克制自己），无论多么坚定正确，都会处于危险的境地，（就像）月亮即将圆缺。如果上位者（在这种情况下）推行他的措施，就会出现祸患。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 最上面的九个，完整的，显示雨是如何落下的，以及（前进的进程）是如何停留的； （所以）我们必须重视德行的充分积累（以上卦为代表）。但妻子（克制），无论多么坚定和正确，都处于危险的境地，（就像）月亮临近满月一样。如果君子实行他的措施（在这种情况下），就会有祸患。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 上九，曰：匹夫经雨，进退不止；故历梯之积善。唯妻执中，无安；如月盈。君子行义，利失。

text.ori_cn: §履：履虎尾不咥人亨。
text.man_en: (Lu suggests the idea of) one treading on the tail of a tiger, which does not bite him. There will be progress and success.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Crawl: Crawl the tiger's tail without paranoia.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Shoes: Walking on the tail of a tiger is not a good thing.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Treading: Treading on the tiger's tail, it does not bite, and there is success.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: (陆游的意思是）一个人踩着老虎的尾巴，老虎却不咬他。就会取得进步和成功。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: （卢提出的想法）人踩虎尾，虎不咬他。将会有进步和成功。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: （卢建议）踩到老虎尾巴，却不会被咬。这将会有进步和成功。

text.ori_cn: 初九：素履往无咎。
text.man_en: The first NINE, undivided, shows its subject treading his accustomed path. If he go forward, there will be no error.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The first nine: Su Crawl towards no blame.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninth day of the lunar month: There will be no blame in the past.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: First Nine: Barefooted progress leads to no misfortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第一个 "九 "是不分割的，它显示了它的主题正在他习惯的道路上行走。如果他向前走，就不会出错。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 前九个完整的，展示了它的主题走着他惯常的道路。如果他继续前进，就不会出现任何错误。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初九，履错然，敬之无咎。

text.ori_cn: 九二：履道坦坦幽人贞吉。
text.man_en: The second NINE, undivided, shows its subject treading the path that is level and easy; a quiet and solitary man, to whom, if he be firm and correct, there will be good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine two: Crawling on the path of the Taoist, the Pantheon is chaste and auspicious.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-Two: Walking on the road calmly and peacefully, people are chaste and auspicious.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Ninety-two: Following a smooth path, the recluse remains steadfast and finds good fortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第二个 "九 "是不分割的，表现的是主人公踏上平坦而轻松的道路；一个安静而孤独的人，如果他坚定而正确，就会有好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第二个“九”，一体，表现出其主题走的是平坦而轻松的道路；一个安静而孤独的人，如果他坚定而正确，就会有好运。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第二爻，初九，显示其主体走在平坦和容易的道路上；一个安静而孤独的人，如果他坚定而正直，将会有好运。

text.ori_cn: 六三：眇能视跛能履履虎尾咥人凶武人为于大君。
text.man_en: The third SIX, divided, shows a oneeyed man (Who thinks he) can see; a lame man (who thinks he) can walk well; one who treads on the tail of a tiger and is bitten. (All this indicates) ill fortune. We have a (mere) bravo acting the part of a great ruler.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Sixth three: Gaze can see and limp can fulfil the tiger's tail paranoid people fierce martial arts for the great ruler.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-three: I can see a lame person who can walk on a tiger's tail, a ferocious warrior, and a great king.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Sixty-three: Though blind, one can still perceive; though lame, one can still walk. Treading on the tiger's tail, he will be bitten, which is ominous. The warrior acts in service of the great ruler.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第三个 "六 "是分割的，表示一个独眼人（自以为）能看见；一个瘸腿的人（自以为）能走好路；一个踩到老虎尾巴被咬的人。(这一切都表明）命运不济。我们看到的是一个（只是）冒充伟大统治者的人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第三个“六”，分开，显示一个独眼的人（他认为他）可以看到；一个瘸子（自以为）能走得很好；踩到老虎尾巴而被咬的人。 （这一切都表明）厄运。我们有一个（仅仅）勇敢的人扮演伟大统治者的角色。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 六三，分裂，瞎子以为他能看见；瘸子以为他能走路；有的人踏在虎尾上并被咬伤。（这一切预示着）凶兆。我们遇到了一个（仅仅是个）小人扮演伟大统治者的角色。

text.ori_cn: 九四：履虎尾愬愬终吉。
text.man_en: The fourth NINE, undivided, shows its subject treading on the tail of a tiger. He becomes full of apprehensive caution, and in the end there will be good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine Four: The tiger's tail and the sue are finally auspicious.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-Four: Walking on the tail of a tiger, it will be auspicious.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Ninety-four: Treading on the tiger's tail, careful and trembling, yet ending in good fortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第四个 "九 "是不分割的，表现的是主人公踩着老虎的尾巴。他变得忐忑不安，小心翼翼，最终将迎来好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第四个九，完整的，表现了它的主题踩在老虎的尾巴上。他变得充满忧虑谨慎，最终会有好运。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第四爻，九不变，象征着其人踩在老虎的尾巴上。他变得充满忧虑和谨慎，最后会有好运。

text.ori_cn: 九五：夬履贞厉。
text.man_en: The fifth NINE, undivided, shows the resolute tread of its subject. Though he be firm and correct, there will be peril.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine five: decisive and chaste.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-five: Be honest and strict.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Nine in the fifth place: Resolutely advancing on the right path, it will be dangerous but will ultimately bring stability.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第五个 "九 "字，没有分割，显示出主体的坚定。尽管他坚定正确，但仍将面临危险。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第五个九，完整地显示了其主题的坚定步伐。虽然他坚定正确，但也会有危险。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九五，不变，显示了其主体的坚定步伐。虽然他坚定而正确，仍有危险。

text.ori_cn: 上九：视履考祥其旋元吉。
text.man_en: The sixth NINE, undivided, tells us to look at (the whole course) that is trodden, and examine the presage which that gives. If it be complete and without failure, there will be great good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The upper nine: the view of the fulfilment of the Kaoxiang its spinning Yuanji.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Upper Nine: Look at the shoes and test the auspiciousness, and the rotation will be auspicious.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Ninth at the top: Observing the journey, investigating the fortune, it returns to the original great auspiciousness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第六个 "九 "是不分割的，它告诉我们要看所走过的（整个历程），并研究它所带来的预示。如果它是完整的，没有失败，就会有巨大的好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第六个九，不可分割，告诉我们要观察所走过的（整个过程），并检查它所给出的预示。若能圆满无败，则有大福。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第六个九，不分开，告诉我们看看走过的（整个过程），并检查它给予的预兆。如果它是完整的并且没有失败，将会有大吉大利。

text.ori_cn: §泰：小往大来吉亨。
text.man_en: In Thai (we see) the little gone and the great come. (It indicates that) there will be good fortune, with progress and success.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Tai: A little goes a long way and Jiheng.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Tai: If you go from small to large, you will be lucky.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Tai: Good fortune comes as the small gives way to the great.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在泰语中，（我们看到）小者去，大者来。(它表示）将会有好运，取得进步和成功。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在泰语中（我们看到），小事已逝，伟大的到来。 （预示）会有好运气，进步，成功。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在泰国（我们看到）小的离去，大的到来。（这表明）将会有好运，进步和成功。

text.ori_cn: 初九：拔茅茹以其汇征吉。
text.man_en: The first NINE, undivided, suggests the idea of grass pulled up, and bringing with it other stalks with whose roots it is connected. Advance (on the part of its subject) will be fortunate.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The first nine: pulling up thatched roofs with their sinks to signify good fortune.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninth day of the lunar month: Pick up Mao Ru and use it to attract good luck.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: First Nine: Pull out the stalks of grass along with their roots; this will lead to good fortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第一个 "九 "是不分割的，暗示着草被拔起，并带来与之相连的其他茎秆。前进（主体方面）将是幸运的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 前九个，不可分割，暗示着草被拔起的想法，并带来了与其根相连的其他茎。进步（就其主体而言）将是幸运的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初九，不割，意为拔草，并带来其他与其根相连的茎。前进（就其主体而言）将会吉祥。

text.ori_cn: 九二：包荒用冯河不遐遗朋亡得尚于中行。
text.man_en: The second NINE, undivided, shows one who can bear with the uncultivated, will cross the Ho without a boat, does not forget the distant, and has no (selfish) friendships. Thus does he prove himself acting in accordance with the course of the due Mean.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Ninety-two: the packet of deserted with Feng He not long left friends dead get still in the middle of the line.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-two: Bao Huang used Feng He Buya and left his friends to die, but he was still in Zhongxing.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When seeking sustenance during a famine, rely on the river for support and do not abandon your friends; in doing so, you will find satisfaction and maintain moral conduct.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第二个 "九 "是 "不分"，"不分 "是 "能容"，"能容 "是 "能忍"，"能忍 "是 "能忍"，"能忍 "是 "能忍"。由此可见，他的行为符合中庸之道。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 下九不分，表示能忍野，无舟过河，不忘远方，无（自私）友谊。这样他就证明自己是按照正当手段行事的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九二，履得其节，能容纳荒野，渡河不舟，不忘远方，无私交。此乃中庸之道焉。

text.ori_cn: 九三：无平不陂无往不复艰贞无咎勿恤其孚于食有福。
text.man_en: The third NINE, undivided, shows that, while there is no state of peace that is not liable to be disturbed, and no departure (of evil men) so that they shall not return, yet when one is firm and correct, as he realizes the distresses that may arise, he will commit no error. There is no occasion for sadness at the certainty (of such recurring changes); and in this mood the happiness (of the present) may be (long) enjoyed.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine three: no flat, not Pei, not to return to the hard chastity without blame, do not share its Vu in the food has a blessing.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-three: There is no level, there is no path, there is no difficulty, there is no difficulty, there is no blame, there is no fault, don’t pity one’s fortune, there is happiness in food.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Nine in the third place: No level ground without a slope, no going without a return. Persevere in difficulty and there will be no blame. Do not worry, confidence in sustaining brings blessings.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第三个 "九 "是不分割的，它表明，虽然没有一种平静的状态不会被打破，也没有一种（坏人）离开后不会再回来，但当一个人意识到可能出现的苦难时，只要他坚定而正确，他就不会犯错。在这种心情下，（当下的）幸福可以（长久）享受。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第三个九，不可分割，表明虽然没有任何平静的状态是不会被扰乱的，也没有（恶人）离开而不会回来，但是当一个人坚定而正确时，正如他所认识到的那样可能出现的烦恼，他不会犯错误。没有必要因为（这种反复发生的变化）的确定性而感到悲伤；在这种心情下，可以（长久）享受（当下的）幸福。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九三，曰：无平不陂，无往不复；艰贞无咎。勿恤其孚，于食有福。

text.ori_cn: 六四：翩翩不富以其邻不戒以孚。
text.man_en: The fourth SIX, divided, shows its subject fluttering (down); not relying on his own rich resources, but calling in his neighbors. (They all come) not as having received warning, but in the sincerity (of their hearts).
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Six Four: Flutter is not rich by its neighbours who do not abstain from the Vu.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-four: If Pianpian is not rich, he will be rich if his neighbors are not careful.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: 64: Graceful but not rich, cautioning his neighbor without warning but sincerely.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第四个 "六 "字，被分割开来，显示出它的主体飘飘然（倒下）；不是依靠自己丰富的资源，而是呼唤他的邻居。(他们都来）不是因为受到警告，而是（出于内心的）真诚。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第四个“六”，分开，显示其主题飘动（向下）；不是依靠自己丰富的资源，而是号召邻居。 (他们都来了)不是因为受到警告,而是因为(他们的内心)真诚。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第四个阴爻，分开，显示出其主体正在扑动（下降）；不是依靠他自己的丰富资源，而是呼唤他的邻居。（他们都来了）不是因为收到了警告，而是因为他们内心的真诚。

text.ori_cn: 六五：帝乙归妹以祉元吉。
text.man_en: The fifth SIX, divided, reminds us of (king) Tiyi's (rule about the) marriage of his younger sister. By such a course there is happiness and there will be great good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Sixth five: Emperor B returns to his sister for the benefit of Yuan Ji.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-Five: Emperor Yi returned to his sister to bring good luck to Yuan Yuan.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Sixty-Five: When King Yi gives his daughter in marriage, it brings great fortune and supreme happiness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第五个 "六 "是 "分"，它让我们想起（国王）帝乙（关于）妹妹婚姻的（规定）。这样就会有幸福，就会有大吉大利。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第五个“六”，分开，让我们想起（国王）提伊（关于）他妹妹的婚姻的（规则）。通过这样的做法，就会有幸福，并且会有很大的福报。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 六五，分裂，提醒我们（国王）提依关于他妹妹婚姻的规则。这样做会带来幸福，并且会有大吉。

text.ori_cn: 上六：城复于隍勿用师自邑告命贞吝。
text.man_en: The sixth SIX, divided, shows us the city wall returned into the moat. It is not the time to use the army. (The subject of the line) may, indeed, announce his orders to the people of his own city; but however correct and firm he may be, he will have cause for regret.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: On the sixth: the city is back in the god do not use the division from the eup to tell the fate of the chastity stingy.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 6: When the city is restored to the emperor, do not use your master to tell the emperor your life.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Six at the top: The city is overturned into a moat. Do not employ an army; from your own town, declare orders. Constancy leads to misfortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第六个 "六"，"分"，让我们看到了城墙回归护城河。现在不是用兵的时候。(行文的主体）确实可以向自己城市的人民宣布他的命令，但无论他多么正确和坚定，他都会有理由感到遗憾。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第六个“六”，分开，向我们展示了城墙返回到护城河中。现在还不是动用军队的时候。 （该行的主题）确实可以向他自己城市的人民宣布他的命令；但无论他多么正确和坚定，他都会有理由后悔。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 六五，城复于隍。勿用师，自邑告命，贞吝。

text.ori_cn: §否：否之匪人不利君子贞大往小来。
text.man_en: In Phi there is the want of good understanding between the (different classes of) men, and its indication is unfavorable to the firm and correct course of the superior man. We see in it the great gone and the little come.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: No: The bandits of No are not favourable to the gentleman Ching's greatness and smallness.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: No: No, bandits are unfavorable to a gentleman.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Denial: Denying without reason harms the superior man; steadfastness leads to great loss and minor returns.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在《斐》中，（不同阶层）的人之间缺乏良好的理解，其表现不利于上等人坚定而正确地前进。我们在其中看到的是大去小来。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在Phi中，人们（不同等级的）人之间缺乏良好的了解，它的迹象不利于君子的坚定和正确的道路。我们从中看到伟大的过去和微小的到来。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在《比》卦中，不同阶级之间缺乏良好的理解，其迹象对君子的坚定正确的行为不利。我们看到大的已经离去，小的已经到来。

text.ori_cn: 初六：拔茅茹以其汇贞吉亨。
text.man_en: The first SIX, divided, suggests the idea of grass pulled up, and bringing with it other stalks with whose roots it is connected. With firm correctness (on the part of its subject), there will be good fortune and progress.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: 初六：拔茅茹以其汇贞吉亨.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: On the sixth day of the lunar month: Pull out Mao Ru and use it to bring Zhen and good luck.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: First Six: Pulling out the grasses, the roots are intertwined. Perseverance brings good fortune and success.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第一个 "六 "是 "分"，寓意草被拔起，并带来与之相连的其他茎秆。只要（主体）坚定正确，就会有好运和进步。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 前六个，分开，暗示了草被拔起的想法，并带来了与其根相连的其他茎。只要坚定正确（就其主体而言），就会有好运和进步。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初六，拔茅茹以其汇，贞吉，亨。

text.ori_cn: 六二：包承小人吉大人否亨。
text.man_en: The second SIX, divided, shows its subject patient and obedient. To the small man (comporting himself so) there will be good fortune. If the great man (comport himself) as the distress and obstruction require, he will have success.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Six Two: Bao Cheng villain Ji adult No Heng.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-two: I promise that the villain will be lucky, but the master will prosper.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Sixty-two: Protection for the petty man is fortune, but for the superior man, it is not beneficial and does not bring success.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第二个 "SIX "被分割开来，显示出主体的耐心和顺从。小人物（这样做）会有好运。如果大人物（如此表现自己）遇到困难和阻碍，他就会获得成功。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第二个“六”，分开，显示其主题耐心和服从。对于小人物（表现得如此）来说，将会有好运。伟人如果能够顺应困境和阻碍，就会成功。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第二爻，六，表示其主体耐心顺从。对于小人（如此举止），将会有好运。如果大人（按困境和阻碍的要求）行事，他将会成功。

text.ori_cn: 六三：包羞。
text.man_en: The third SIX, divided, shows its subject ashamed of the purpose folded (in his breast).
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Sixty-three: wrapped in shame.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-three: Bao Shame.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Sixty-three: Being enveloped in shame.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第三个 "SIX"（分割）显示其主体因折叠（在胸前）的目的而感到羞愧。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第三个“六”，分裂，表明其主体对折叠的目的（在他的胸中）感到羞耻。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第三爻，象征羞愧于心怀的志向。

text.ori_cn: 九四：有命无咎畴离祉。
text.man_en: The fourth NINE, undivided, shows its subject acting in accordance with the ordination (of Heaven), and committing no error. His companions will come and share in his happiness.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine-four: There is a life without blame category away from well-being.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-Four: There is no blame for fate and good fortune.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Ninety-four: With destiny unmarred, blessings will not be distant.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第四个 "九 "是不分割的，表明其主体按照（上天的）命令行事，不会犯错。他的同伴将前来分享他的幸福。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第四个九，不分，表明其主体按照天命行事，没有错误。他的同伴会来分享他的快乐。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第四爻，九不变，表示其主体按照天命行事，并且没有错误。他的同伴们会来分享他的快乐。

text.ori_cn: 九五：休否大人吉其亡其亡系于苞桑。
text.man_en: In the fifth NINE, undivided, we see him who brings the distress and obstruction to a close, the great man and fortunate. (But let him say), ‘We may perish! We may perish!' (so shall the state of things become firm, as if bound to a clump of bushy mulberry trees.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine five: Hugh or not, the adults are lucky that their deaths are tied to the bracts of the mulberry.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-five: Sir, your death is tied to the bud mulberry.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Position Nine in the Fifth place: Great person, are you ceaselessly given good fortune? The misfortune ceased, ceasing like mulberry trees growing.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在第五个 "九 "中，我们看到的是将苦难和阻碍化为乌有的伟人和幸运儿。(他说：'我们可能会灭亡！我们可能会灭亡！我们可能会灭亡！'（这样，事物的状态就会变得稳固，就像被束缚在一丛茂密的桑树上一样。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在第五个九，完整的，我们看到他结束了痛苦和障碍，伟大的人和幸运的人。 （但让他说）‘我们可能会灭亡！我们可能会灭亡！ （如此，事物的状态就会变得牢固，如束缚在茂密的桑树丛中一样。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在九五，初爻，无咎者，终乃困穷。大人吉祥。（但使他说），‘我们可能灭亡！我们可能灭亡！’，（如此局势便坚固，犹如紧系于茂盛的桑树丛。）

text.ori_cn: 上九：倾否先否后喜。
text.man_en: The sixth NINE, undivided, shows the overthrow (and removal of) the condition of distress and obstruction. Before this there was that condition. Hereafter there will be joy.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Upper 9: Tipping No first No and then hi.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Shangjiu: If you want to say no first, please say no first and then be happy.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Top Nine: There is disappointment at first, but joy follows afterward.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第六个 "九 "是不分割的，表示推翻（和消除）苦恼和阻碍的状况。在此之前，有这种状况。此后将是欢乐。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第六九，完整，显示推翻（和消除）苦恼和障碍的状况。在此之前就有这样的条件。以后就会有欢乐。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第六爻，九不变，象征困厄和阻碍被推翻（和移除）。之前是这样的情况。之后将会有喜悦。

text.ori_cn: §同人：同人于野亨利涉大川利君子贞。
text.man_en: Thung Zan (or 'Union of men') appears here (as we find it) in the (remote districts of the) country, indicating progress and success. It will be advantageous to cross the great stream. It will be advantageous to maintain the firm correctness of the superior man.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Homo sapiens: Homo sapiens in the wild Henry wades through a great river to benefit a gentleman's chastity.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Same person: Same person in the wild, Henry Shida Okawa Toshiko Zada.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The same virtue: If one preserves the same virtue in the countryside, one shall gain fortune and cross great rivers successfully; it is favorable for a gentleman to remain steadfast.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: Thung Zan（或 "人的联盟"）出现在（我们发现的）这个国家的（偏远地区），表示进步和成功。渡过大河是有利的。有利于保持高人的坚定正确。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: Thung Zan（或“人类联盟”）出现在这个国家（的偏远地区）（正如我们所发现的），表明进步和成功。渡大流有利。有利于保持君子的坚定正确性。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 同人（或称‘人类的联合’）出现在这里（正如我们所发现的）在（偏远地区的）国家里，表明了进步和成功。渡过大河是有利的。保持君子的刚正是有利的。

text.ori_cn: 初九：同人于门无咎。
text.man_en: The first NINE, undivided, (shows the representative of) the union of men just issuing from his gate. There will be no error.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: First nine: the same person at the door without blame.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninth day of the lunar month: There is no blame for being in the same family.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: First Nine: Union with people at the gate brings no blame.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第一个 "九"，没有被分割，（显示）代表了刚从他的大门走出来的人的联合。不会出错。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 前九个，完整的，（显示）刚刚从他的大门出来的人类联盟的代表。不会有错误。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初九，不远之兆，出门交接，无咎。

text.ori_cn: 六二：同人于宗吝。
text.man_en: The second SIX, divided, (shows the representative of) the union of men in relation with his kindred. There will be occasion for regret.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: VI.2: The same person in Zongjian.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-two: Fellow Yu Zongqing.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Sixty-two: Fellowship with those of the same ancestry brings misfortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第二个 "六"，"分"，（代表）人与其亲属的结合。会有遗憾的时候。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第二个六，分开，（显示）人类与其亲属的联合的代表。会有后悔的时候。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第二爻，六，分裂，（象征）人与其亲属联合。会有悔恨的机会。

text.ori_cn: 九三：伏戎于莽升其高陵三岁不兴。
text.man_en: The third NINE, undivided, (shows its subject) with his arms hidden in the thick grass, and at the top of a high mound. (But) for three years he makes no demonstration.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Jiu San: Fu Rong Yu Mang rises his high mausoleum for three years without prospering.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-three: Fu Rong was promoted to Gaoling in Mang and was unhappy at the age of three.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The third line: He subdues the nomads in the wilderness and ascends to his high mound; for three years, he will not rise.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第三幅九宫格，没有分割，（画面中）主体的双臂藏在茂密的草丛中，站在高高的土丘顶端。(但）三年来，他没有任何表现。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第三个九，完整的，（显示其主题）他的手臂隐藏在茂密的草丛中，在一个高土丘的顶部。 （但是）三年来他没有做出任何示范。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九三：伏戎于莽，升其高陵，三岁不兴。

text.ori_cn: 九四：乘其墉弗克攻吉。
text.man_en: The fourth NINE, undivided, (shows its subject) mounted on the city wall; but he does not proceed to make the attack (he contemplates). There will be good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine four: multiply its city wall Fokke attack auspicious.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-four: Take advantage of the enemy to attack Ji.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Ninety-four: Attempting to scale the wall without success brings good fortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第四个 "九"，没有分割，（显示其主体）骑在城墙上；但他并没有继续发动（他所考虑的）攻击。会有好运的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第四个九，未分割，（显示其主题）安装在城墙上；但他并没有继续发动攻击（他沉思着）。将会有好运。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初六，无妄，登于城墙之上；不进攻预想的对象，有福。

text.ori_cn: 九五：同人先号咷而后笑大师克相遇。
text.man_en: In the fifth NINE, undivided, (the representative of) the union of men first wails and cries out, and then laughs. His great host conquers, and he (and the subject of the second line) meet together.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Ninety-five: the same person first numbered 咷 and then laughed at the Master Gram encounter.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 95: Fans first screamed and then laughed when Master Ke met.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Nine in the fifth place: Companions first cry out and weep, then laugh. The great leader finds himself successfully in harmony.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在第五行 "九 "中，"人 "的结合（代表）先是哭泣、呐喊，然后大笑。他伟大的主人被征服了，他（和第二行的主题）相会在一起。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第五九，不分，人类的联合（代表）先是哭喊，然后是笑。他的伟大的主人征服了，他（和第二行的主题）聚集在一起。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九五，贞吉，归妹以须，夫来得女吉。

text.ori_cn: 上九：同人于郊无悔。
text.man_en: The topmost NINE, undivided, (shows the representative of) the union of men in the suburbs. There will be no occasion for repentance.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Upper 9: The same people in the suburbs have no regrets.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 9: The same person has no regrets in the suburbs.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Ninth at the top: Union with others in the outskirts, no regrets.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 最上面的 "九"，没有分割，（代表）郊区的人的结合。没有悔改的机会。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 最上面的九个，完整的，（显示）郊区男性联盟的代表。不会有任何悔改的机会。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 上九，无咎，伪合人于郊，无悔。

text.ori_cn: §大有：元亨。
text.man_en: Da Yu indicates that, (under the circumstances which it implies), there will be great progress and success.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Da-You: Yuan-Heng.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Dayou: Yuanheng.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Dayou: Great and Smooth.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 大禹治水表明（在它所暗示的情况下），将会取得巨大的进步和成功。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 大禹表示，（在它所暗示的情况下）将会有巨大的进步和成功。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 大禹表示，在这些情形下，将会有巨大的进步和成功。

text.ori_cn: 初九：无交害匪咎艰则无咎。
text.man_en: In the first NINE, undivided, there is no approach to what is injurious, and there is no error. Let there be a realization of the difficulty (and danger of the position), and there will be no error (to the end).
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: 初九：没有交害匪咎艰则无咎。
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninth day of the lunar month: If there is no harm, there will be no blame.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: First Nine: No mischief without blame; though arduous, there will be no blame.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在第一个 "九 "中，不分割，就不会接近有害的东西，也就不会有错误。认识到立场的困难（和危险），就不会出错（到最后）。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 前九，不分，不接近有害的东西，也不存在错误。让人们认识到困难（以及处境的危险），就不会出现错误（直到最后）。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初九，潜龙勿用，阳在下也。用九，见群龙无首，吉。

text.ori_cn: 九二：大车以载有攸往无咎。
text.man_en: In the second NINE, undivided, we have a large wagon with its load. In whatever direction advance is made, there will be no error.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine two: a big car to carry a distant future without blame.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-Two: A large cart carries everything that goes well.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Nine in the second place: With a large cart to carry, having a direction to go brings no blame.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在第二个九号车厢，我们有一辆装满货物的大马车。无论向哪个方向前进，都不会出错。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在第二个九号车中，我们有一辆满载货物的大货车。无论朝哪个方向前进，都不会出错。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在第二个九爻，不分散的情况下，我们有一辆装载着货物的大车。不论向哪个方向前进，都不会出错。

text.ori_cn: 九三：公用亨于天子小人弗克。
text.man_en: The third NINE, undivided, shows us a feudal prince presenting his offerings to the Son of Heaven. A small man would be unequal (to such a duty).
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine-three: public use of Hen in the son of heaven, the small man Fok.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-three: The public is prosperous with the emperor's villain Fuke.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Ninth Three: The noble one is able to enjoy favor with the ruler, but the petty man cannot achieve this.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第三个 "九 "是不分割的，它向我们展示了一位封建王朝的王子向天子献上他的祭品。一个小人物是无法胜任这样的职责的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第三个九，完整地向我们展示了一个封建王子向天子献上他的供品。一个小人物将无法承担这样的责任。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九三，君子将天子供奉呈现。小人无法胜任这样的职责。

text.ori_cn: 九四：匪其彭无咎。
text.man_en: The fourth NINE, undivided, shows its subject keeping his great resources under restraint. There will be no error.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine-four: Bandit its pang without blame.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-Four: Bandit Peng Wujiu.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Ninth four: If it is not a crashing sound, there will be no blame.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第四个 "九 "是不分割的，它显示了主体对其巨大资源的克制。不会出错。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第四个九，完整的，显示其主题保持其巨大的资源受到限制。不会有错误。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初九，不动如山，藏锋守势，无咎。

text.ori_cn: 六五：厥孚交如威如吉。
text.man_en: The fifth SIX, divided, shows the sincerity of its subject reciprocated by that of all the others (represented in the hexagram). Let him display a proper majesty, and there will be good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Sixty-five: the syncopated Vu crosses like Wei like Ji.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-five: Jue Fu's friendship is as powerful as good luck.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Sixty-Five: His sincerity is met with mutual respect and awe; this is auspicious.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第五个 "六 "被分割开来，显示出其主体的诚意与所有其他主体（爻辞中的代表）的诚意相互呼应。让他表现出应有的威严，就会有好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第五六，分开，显示了其主体的诚意得到了所有其他人（以卦象表示）的回报。让他表现出适当的威严，就会有好运。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第五爻，阴爻，显示其主体的诚意得到了所有其他人的回应（在卦象中表示）。让他表现出适当的威严，会有好运。

text.ori_cn: 上九：自天佑之吉无不利。
text.man_en: The topmost NINE, undivided, shows its subject with help accorded to him from Heaven. There will be good fortune, advantage in every respect.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Upper 9: Since the blessing of God's auspiciousness is not unfavourable.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 9: Since God’s blessing, there will be no disadvantages.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Top Nine: Blessed by the heavens, auspicious without any misfortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 最顶端的九宫格，不分彼此，显示其主体得到了上天的帮助。会有好运，各方面都有好处。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 最上面的九个，完整的，在天堂给予他的帮助下展示了它的主题。将会有好运，各方面都有优势。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 上九，乾，见群龙无首，吉。

text.ori_cn: §谦：亨君子有终。
text.man_en: Khien indicates progress and success. The superior man, (being humble as it implies), will have a (good) issue (to his undertakings).
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Humble: Heng Junzi has an end.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Qian: A gentleman will eventually die.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Humility: There is prosperity; the gentleman has an ending.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 谦表示进步和成功。上等人，（谦虚的意思），（他的事业）会有（好的）结果。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: Khien 表示进步和成功。君子（谦虚）会有（好的）问题（他的事业）。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 乾象征进取与成功。君子（因为它隐含的谦逊），将有一个（好的）结果（在他的事业中）。

text.ori_cn: 初六：谦谦君子用涉大川吉。
text.man_en: The first SIX, divided, shows us the superior man who adds humility to humility. (Even) the great stream may be crossed with this, and there will be good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: 初六：谦谦君子用涉大川吉.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: On the sixth day of the lunar month: A humble gentleman uses Shedachuanji.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The humble gentleman embarking on a great journey will be fortunate.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第一个 "SIX"（分割）向我们展示了谦卑之上再加谦卑的高人。(即使）滔滔大河也能以此渡过，而且会有好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 前六分，向我们展示了谦卑中加谦卑的君子。 （甚至）大溪可以渡过，就会有福气。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初六，谦谦君子，过大川，有吉。

text.ori_cn: 六二：鸣谦贞吉。
text.man_en: The second SIX, divided, shows us humility that has made itself recognized. With firm correctness there will be good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Six-two: Mingqianzhen jingji.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-two: Ming Qian Zhenji.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Hexagram 62: Modesty leads to success and good fortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第二个 "SIX "是 "分"，它向我们展示了谦逊的态度，这种谦逊已经得到了认可。只要坚定正确，就会有好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第二个“六”，分开，向我们展示了已经得到认可的谦逊。坚定正确就会有好运。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第二个六，分离，向我们展示了已经被认可的谦逊。坚持正直会有好运。

text.ori_cn: 九三：劳谦君子有终吉。
text.man_en: The third NINE, undivided, shows the superior man of (acknowledged) merit. He will maintain his success to the end, and have good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine three: the labouring humble gentleman has an end of good fortune.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-three: A humble gentleman will have good luck in the end.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Ninety-three: A diligent and humble gentleman will have a fortunate outcome in the end.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第三个 "九 "是不分割的，表示有（公认）功绩的高人。他会将成功进行到底，并拥有好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第三九，不分，显示君子的功德。他将把自己的成功保持到底，并拥有好运。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九三，君子有功，终将保持成功，并享有好运。

text.ori_cn: 六四：无不利撝谦。
text.man_en: The fourth SIX, divided, shows one, whose action would be in every way advantageous, stirring up (the more) his humility.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Six-four: No disadvantage for Hugh Moss.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-four: No disadvantages to Qian Qian.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Hexagram 64: There is nothing disadvantageous in maintaining humility.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第四个 "SIX"，"分"，表示一个人，他的行动在各方面都是有利的，会（更加）激起他的谦卑。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第四个六，分开，表明一个人，他的行动在各方面都是有利的，激发（更多）他的谦卑。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 六四，分列，行动无不有利，激发他的谦逊。

text.ori_cn: 六五：不富以其邻利用侵伐无不利。
text.man_en: The fifth SIX, divided, shows one who, without being rich, is able to employ his neighbors. He may advantageously use the force of arms. All his movements will be advantageous.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: VI.5: No wealth to its neighbours to take advantage of the invasion without disadvantage.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-five: If you are not rich, your neighbors will take advantage of you and invade and cut them down.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Sixty-Five: Not gaining wealth through neighboring states, using invasion and plunder brings no benefit.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第五个 "六 "是 "分"，表示一个人虽然不富裕，却能雇用他的邻居。他可以有利地使用武力。他的所有行动都将是有利的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第五个六，分开，表明一个人即使不富有，也能够雇用他的邻居。他可以有利地使用武力。他的一切举动都将是有利的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初六，分裂，像一个虽然不富有但能够雇佣邻居的人。他可以有利地使用武力。他的所有行动都会有利。

text.ori_cn: 上六：鸣谦利用行师征邑国。
text.man_en: The sixth SIX, divided, shows us humility that has made itself recognized. The subject of it will with advantage put his hosts in motion; but (he will only) punish his own towns and state.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: On the sixth: Ming Qian used the Hsing Shi to conquer Eup Guo.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 6: Ming Qian used his troops to conquer the country.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Top six: Humble speech is announced, suitable for deploying the army and conquering the city's state.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第六个 "六 "是 "分"，它向我们展示了谦卑的态度，这种谦卑已经得到了认可。它的主体会让他的主人行动起来，但（他只会）惩罚他自己的城镇和国家。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第六个“六”，分开，向我们展示了已经得到认可的谦逊。它的主题将有利于让他的东道主行动起来。但（他只会）惩罚他自己的城镇和州。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初六，谦谦君子，君子有益出行，不妖扰乡邑。

text.ori_cn: §豫：利建侯行师。
text.man_en: Yu indicates that, (in the state which it implies), feudal princes may be set up, and the hosts put in motion, with advantage.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Yu: Li Jianhou Xing Shi.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Yu: Li Jianhou went to the army.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Yu: Send the troops with the approval of the Marquis.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 大禹治水表明，（在它所暗示的状态下），封建王侯的建立和主人的调动都是有利的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 于表明，（在其所暗示的国家中）可以设立诸侯，并发动军队，以有利。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 禹指出，在它所暗示的状态下，封疆大吏可以被设置，军队可以被调动，并且会有好处。

text.ori_cn: 初六：鸣豫凶。
text.man_en: The first SIX, divided, shows its subject proclaiming his pleasure and satisfaction. There will be evil.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: First six: Ming Yu is bad.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixth day of the lunar month: The name Yu is ominous.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: First Six: The call of contentment brings misfortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第一个 "SIX "被分割开来，显示出它的主体在宣布他的快乐和满足。会有邪恶。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 前六个，分开，显示其主题，宣告他的快乐和满足。会有邪恶。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初六，分明显示其满足与喜悦，必有凶险。

text.ori_cn: 六二：介于石不终日贞吉。
text.man_en: The second SIX, divided, shows one who is firm as a rock. (He sees a thing) without waiting till it has come to pass; with his firm correctness there will be good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: VI.2: Between a stone and not the end of the day chaste and auspicious.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-Two: The stone will not last forever.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Sixty-two: While in a difficult position, if one remains perseverant all day, there will be good fortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第二个 "六 "是 "分"，表示坚如磐石。(他看到一件事）不等它实现，只要他坚定正确，就会有好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第二个“六”，分开，显示出坚如磐石的人。 （他看到一件事）没有等到它发生；只要他坚定正确，就会有好运。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第二个六，分裂，象征着坚定如磐石的人。（他看到事情）不等待直到它发生；坚持正固将会有好运。

text.ori_cn: 六三：盱豫悔迟有悔。
text.man_en: The third SIX, divided, shows one looking up (for favors), while he indulges the feeling of pleasure and satisfaction. If he would understand! If he be late in doing so, there will indeed be occasion for repentance.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Sixth three: xuyu repentance late with regret.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-three: Xuyu regrets later.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Six in the third place: Hesitation brings regret, but caution leads to remorse.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第三个 "SIX"，"分"，表示一个人仰望（恩惠），而他沉浸在快乐和满足的感觉中。如果他能理解！如果他迟迟不明白，那就真的有必要忏悔了。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第三个六，分开，显示一个人向上看（寻求恩惠），同时他沉迷于快乐和满足的感觉。如果他能明白就好了！如果晚了，确实还有悔改的机会。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第三爻，分，显示一个人向上看（寻求恩惠），同时沉浸在愉悦和满足的感觉中。如果他能理解！如果他迟迟不这样做，确实会有悔恨的时刻。

text.ori_cn: 九四：由豫大有得勿疑朋盍簪。
text.man_en: The fourth NINE, undivided, shows him from whom the harmony and satisfaction come. Great is the success which he obtains. Let him not allow suspicions to enter his mind, and thus friends will gather around him.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine-four: By Yu Dai have gained do not doubt the peng qi zhan.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-Four: If you get something from Henan University, don’t doubt your friend’s hairpin.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Six Four: When there is great gain represented by 豫 (pleasure), do not doubt. Friends gather together like the hairpins in a hairknot.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第四个 "九 "是不分割的，表明和谐与满足来自于他。他将获得巨大的成功。不要让猜疑进入他的头脑，这样朋友就会聚集在他周围。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第四个九，不可分割，向他展示了和谐和满足来自于谁。他获得的成功是伟大的。让他不让怀疑进入他的心中，这样朋友就会聚集在他的周围。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第四爻，未分，显示了带来和谐与满足的人。他获得的成功非常大。不要让怀疑进入他的心中，这样朋友们就会聚集在他身边。

text.ori_cn: 六五：贞疾恒不死。
text.man_en: The fifth SIX, divided, shows one with a chronic complaint, but who lives on without dying.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Sixty-five: chaste illnesses do not always lead to death.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-five: Zhenji will never die.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Sixty-five: Persistent illness will not lead to death.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第五个 "SIX "是 "分裂"，表现的是一个患有慢性疾病的人，但他没有死去，而是继续活着。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第五个“六”，分开，显示一个患有慢性疾病的人，但他仍然活着而没有死亡。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第五爻，分隔，显示一个长期患病的人，但却活着而没有死去。

text.ori_cn: 上六：冥豫成有渝无咎。
text.man_en: The topmost SIX, divided, shows its subject with darkened mind devoted to the pleasure and satisfaction (of the time); but if he change his course even when (it may be considered as) completed, there will be no error.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Upper Sixth: Hei Yu Cheng Yu has no blame.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 6: Mingyu becomes a person with no fault.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Top Six: While in dark hesitation, change may emerge without blame.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 最上面的 "SIX"（分割）表明，它的主体心智昏暗，一心只想着（当时的）快乐和满足；但如果他改变方向，即使（它可能被视为）已经完成，也不会有任何错误。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 最上面的六个，分开，显示了其主题，其黑暗的心灵致力于（当时的）快乐和满足；但如果他改变路线，即使（可以认为）已经完成，也不会出现错误。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 上九，暗昧其心，归妖恶肆，若得用恒，终无咎。

text.ori_cn: §随：元亨利贞无咎。
text.man_en: Sui indicates that (under its conditions) there will be great progress and success. But it will be advantageous to be firm and correct. There will (then) be no error.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: With: Yuanhenglizhen is blameless.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: With: Yuan Henry is innocent and innocent.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Following: There is no blame in being fundamentally auspicious, strong, and persevering.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 穗表示（在其条件下）将取得巨大的进步和成功。但是，坚定和正确是有利的。这样就不会出错。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 隋表示（在其条件下）将会有很大的进步和成功。但坚定、正确是有利的。 （那么）就不会有错误。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 随象征着在它的条件下会有巨大的进步和成功。但保持坚定和正确是有利的。这样便不会有错误。

text.ori_cn: 初九：官有渝贞吉出门交有功。
text.man_en: The first NINE, undivided, shows us one changing the object of his pursuit; but if he be firm and correct, there will be good fortune. Going beyond (his own) gate to find associates, he will achieve merit.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: 初九：官有渝贞吉出门交有功。
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninth day of the lunar month: The official has Yu Zhenji and goes out to make meritorious service.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: First Nine: If a government official makes a change and remains upright, it will bring good fortune. Going out to interact will be beneficial.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第一个 "九 "是不分割的，让我们看到一个人在改变自己的追求目标；但如果他坚定正确，就会有好运。超越（自己的）大门去寻找伙伴，他将获得功德。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 前九个整体向我们展示了一个人不断变化的追求对象；但如果他坚定而正确，就会有好运。超越自己的门去寻找同伙，就会获得功德。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初九，杂遝其贵，贞吉。出门交有功。

text.ori_cn: 六二：系小子失丈夫。
text.man_en: The second SIX, divided, shows us one who cleaves to the little boy, and lets go the man of age and experience.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Six-two: the Department of Boys Lost Husbands.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-two: The boy lost his husband.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Line Six Two: Tying up the boy leads to losing the man.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第二个 "SIX"，即 "分裂"，让我们看到了一个依附于小男孩的人，而放走了有年龄和经验的人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第二个六人分开，向我们展示了一个紧紧抓住小男孩的人，而放弃了年龄和经验丰富的人。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第二个六，分开，显示了一个人依附于小男孩，而放弃了有年龄和经验的人。

text.ori_cn: 六三：系丈夫失小子随有求得利居贞。
text.man_en: The third SIX, divided, shows us one who cleaves to the man of age and experience, and lets go the little boy. Such following will get what it seeks; but it will be advantageous to adhere to what is firm and correct.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Sixth three: the husband lost the boy with a request to gain the benefit of living in chastity.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-three: When the husband loses his son, he will be in chastity for the benefit of others.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Six in the third place: If one binds the husband and loses the child, one gains through seeking and achieves profit by maintaining constancy.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第三个 "六 "是 "分"，它向我们展示了一个人如何追随年长和经验丰富的人，而放走一个小男孩。这样的追随会得到它所追求的东西；但是，坚持坚定和正确的东西是有好处的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第三个六人，分开，向我们展示了一个紧随年龄和经验的人而放弃小男孩的人。这样的追随者将会得到它所寻求的；但坚持坚定正确的事情是有利的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初六，分裂，象徵堅持年長有經驗的人，捨棄小孩。這樣的追隨會得到它所追求的；但堅持正固的原則是有利的。

text.ori_cn: 九四：随有获贞凶有孚在道以明何咎。
text.man_en: The fourth NINE, undivided, shows us one followed and obtaining (adherents). Though he be firm and correct, there will be evil. If he be sincere (however) in his course, and make that evident, into what error will he fall?”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine-four: With a gain of chastity and murder, there is a fu in the road in order to understand what the blame is.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-Four: With the success of chastity and evil, there is prosperity in the way, so as to understand what is to blame.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Nine Four: Although there is misfortune in obtaining constancy, there is confidence in the path that is clear. What blame could there be?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第四个 "九 "是 "不分割"，让我们看到一个人被追随并获得（追随者）。虽然他坚定正确，但也会有邪恶。然而，如果他在自己的道路上是真诚的，并使之显而易见，他会陷入什么错误呢？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第四个九，不可分割，向我们展示了一个被追随和获得的（追随者）。虽坚定正直，但必有祸患。如果他（然而）在他的做法上是真诚的，并且表明这一点，那么他会犯什么错误呢？”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九四，不妖，肅仍正，其凶。設心誠用，明示之，有何過乎？

text.ori_cn: 九五：孚于嘉吉。
text.man_en: The fifth NINE, undivided, shows us (the ruler) sincere in (fostering all) that is excellent. There will be good fortune.
