text.man_en: The fifth NINE, undivided, shows the water of the defile not yet full, (so that it might flow away); but order will (soon) be brought about. There will be no error.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine five: Kan is not surplus and is not to be blamed.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-five: If the obstacle is not enough, there is no fault.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Nine Five: The pitfall is not full, it is already leveled, no blame.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第五个 "九 "是不分割的，表明污秽之水还没有流满（以便流走）；但秩序将（很快）实现。不会再有错误。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第五个“九”不分，表示沟水未满（以便流走）；但秩序将会（很快）得到落实。不会有错误。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九五，不变，峡谷中的水尚未满，（所以还不会流走）；但秩序（很快）将会恢复。不会有错。

text.ori_cn: 上六：系用徽纆寘于丛棘三岁不得凶。
text.man_en: The topmost SIX, divided, shows its subject bound with cords of three strands or two strands, and placed in the thicket of thorns. But in three years he does not learn the course for him to pursue. There will be evil.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The first six: put down the cord and put down the thorns for three years.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixth chapter: The emblem is placed on the thorn bush and it will not be bad for three years.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Top six: Bound with soft cords and placed among thorny bushes, for three years he meets no misfortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 最上面的 "SIX "被分割开来，显示出其主体被三股或两股绳索捆绑，并被放置在荆棘丛中。但是，在三年里，他并没有学到他要走的路。会有邪恶。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 最上面的六尊被分开，显示其主体被三股或两股绳索捆绑，并放置在荆棘丛中。但三年后他并没有学到他要学习的课程。会有邪恶。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 上九，分裂，象征其人被三股或两股绳索绑住，置于荆棘丛中。然而三年之内他未能学会他的道路。会有凶险。

text.ori_cn: §离：利贞亨畜牝牛吉。
text.man_en: Li indicates that, (in regard to what it denotes), it will be advantageous to be firm and correct, and that thus there will be free course and success. Let (its subject) also nourish (a docility like that of) the cow, and there will be good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Li: Li Ching Heng Animal Mare Auspicious.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Li: Lucky and prosperous, the animal is auspicious.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Li: Advantageous and steadfast, auspicious for raising cows.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 李 "表示，（就其所表示的内容而言），坚定而正确将是有利的，因此将获得自由和成功。让（它的对象）也养成（像牛一样的温顺），就会有好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 李指出，（就其所指而言），有利于坚定正确，从而有自由的方向和成功。让（其臣民）也养牛（像牛那样温顺），就会有福气。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 《礼》指出，（就其所指而言），固守正道将会有利可图，这样便能顺利通达。若（其主体）也能养成如同母牛般的温顺，就会有福气。

text.ori_cn: 初九：履错然敬之无咎。
text.man_en: The first NINE, undivided, shows one ready to move with confused steps. But he treads at the same time reverently, and there will be no mistake.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The first nine: Crawl wrongly and respect without blame.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninth day of the lunar month: If you make a mistake, there is no blame for it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: First Nine: Treading upon an uneven path with caution, there will be no blame.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第一个 "九"，没有分割，显示出一个人准备迈着混乱的步伐。但他同时虔诚地踏着，不会有任何差错。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 前九个未分割的，显示出准备好以混乱的步骤移动。但他同时迈步恭敬，不会有任何差错。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初九，潜龙勿用。慎行谨慎，则无祸害。

text.ori_cn: 六二：黄离元吉。
text.man_en: The second SIX, divided, shows its subject in his place in yellow. There will be great good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Six two: Huang Li Yuan Ji.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-two: Huang Li Yuanji.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Line Six: The yellow garments bring fundamental good fortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第二个 "SIX "被分割开来，黄色显示了主体的位置。将有巨大的好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第二个“六”，分开，以黄色显示其主体在他的位置。将会有很大的福气。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第二爻，六，分开，表示其主体在黄色的地方。将会有很大的好运。

text.ori_cn: 九三：日昃之离不鼓缶而歌则大耋之嗟凶。
text.man_en: The third NINE, undivided, shows its subject in a position like that of the declining sun. Instead of playing on his instrument of earthenware, and singing to it, he utters the groans of an old man of eighty. There will be evil.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine-three: Jackson's departure from the sun without drumming and singing is a big old contempt fierce.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-three: If the sun leaves without drumming the fou but sings, the big grasshopper will complain fiercely.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Nine three: When the sun is at its setting, if you do not play drums and sing, it will lead to the lament of the elderly, which is ominous.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第三个 "九 "是不分割的，它表现了主人公的处境，就像衰落的太阳。他不再弹奏陶器，不再对着陶器歌唱，而是发出八十岁老人的呻吟。会有邪恶。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第三个九，整体，以落日般的位置展示其主题。他没有演奏陶器、唱歌，而是发出八十岁老人的呻吟声。会有邪恶。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九三：日昃之位，其人若兝兮，勿鼓盆而歌，则大耋之嗟，凶。

text.ori_cn: 九四：突如其来如焚如死如弃如。
text.man_en: The fourth NINE, undivided, shows the manner of its subject's coming. How abrupt it is, as with fire, with death, to be rejected (by all)!
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine-four: sudden as burning as death as abandonment.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-four: Sudden, like burning, like death, like being abandoned.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Ninth Four: Sudden as if burning, as if dying, as if being abandoned.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第四个 "九"，没有分割，显示了其主题的降临方式。它是多么突然，就像火，就像死亡，被（所有人）拒绝！
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第四个“九”，完整的，显示了其主题的到来方式。被（所有人）拒绝是多么突然，就像火、死亡一样！
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第四爻，初九，不变，显示其人的来临。多么突然，就像火一样，伴随着死亡，被所有人拒绝！

text.ori_cn: 六五：出涕沱若戚嗟若吉。
text.man_en: The fifth SIX, divided, shows its subject as one with tears flowing in torrents, and groaning in sorrow. There will be good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Sixty-five: out of snot if chi contempt if auspicious.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-five: Tears are like tears, and sighing is like luck.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Sixty-Five: Shedding tears of sorrow and grief—but this will lead to fortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第五个 "SIX"（分割）显示其主题是一个泪流满面、悲伤呻吟的人。会有好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第五首《六》，分裂，显示其主题为一，泪流满面，悲叹。将会有好运。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第六爻，离开，显示其主体泪如泉涌，哀叹悲伤。将有好运。

text.ori_cn: 上九：王用出征有嘉折首获匪其丑无咎。
text.man_en: The topmost NINE, undivided, shows the king employing its subject in his punitive expeditions. Achieving admirable (merit), he breaks (only) the chiefs (of the rebels). Where his prisoners were not their associates, he does not punish. There will be no error.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Upper nine: the king used to go out to war with Jia folding the head to get bandit its ugly no blame.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 9: Wang Yong went on an expedition with great success and captured the first bandit, but his ugliness was not to blame.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Top Nine: The king leads an expedition and captures the enemy chief; there is no misfortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 最上面的 "九 "字，没有分割，显示的是国王在惩罚性征伐中使用的主题。他取得了令人钦佩的（功绩），（只）击溃了（叛军）首领。如果他的俘虏不是他们的同伙，他就不会惩罚。不会有错。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 最上面的九个，完整的，展示了国王在他的惩罚性远征中使用它的主题。他取得了令人钦佩的（功绩），他（仅）击败了（叛军的）首领。如果他的囚犯不是他们的同伙，他不会惩罚。不会有错误。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 上九，无咎，王用之，征伐，克威，折首，擒不成伦，不辱，无咎。

text.ori_cn: §咸：亨利贞取女吉。
text.man_en: Hsien indicates that, (on the fulfillment of the conditions implied in it), there will be free course and success. Its advantageousness will depend on the being firm and correct, (as) in marrying a young lady. There will be good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Ham: Henry Ching takes the female lucky.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Xian: Henry's virginity is auspicious for women.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Salt: obtaining a virtuous wife brings good fortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 贤表示，（在满足其中隐含的条件时），将有自由的过程和成功。它的好处取决于坚定和正确，（就像）娶一位年轻的女士。会有好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 贤指出，（在满足其中隐含的条件的情况下），将会有自由的道路和成功。其优点取决于坚定和正确，（如）娶一位年轻女士。将会有好运。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 咸卦预示着，如果符合其中暗示的条件，将会通行无阻并取得成功。其吉祥将取决于坚定和正确，就像迎娶一位年轻的女士一样。将会有好运。

text.ori_cn: 初六：咸其拇。
text.man_en: The first SIX, divided, shows one moving his great toes.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: First six: Ham its thumb.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The sixth day of the lunar month: Salt your thumb.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: First Six: There is hesitation at the toes.

text.ori_cn: 六二：咸其腓凶居吉。
text.man_en: The second SIX, divided, shows one moving the calves of his leg. There will be evil. If he abide (quiet in his place), there will be good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Six two: Ham its fibre of evil in good fortune.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-two: Xian Qifei is inauspicious and good luck lies in it.

text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第二爻，象曰，动其膝，不吉。若静，吉。

text.ori_cn: 九三：咸其股执其随往吝。

text.ori_cn: 九四：贞吉悔亡憧憧往来朋从尔思。
text.man_en: The fourth NINE, undivided, shows that firm correctness which will lead to good fortune, and prevent all occasion for repentance. If its subject be unsettled in his movements, (only) his friends will follow his purpose.

text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-Four: Zhenji regrets his death, looks forward to his friends, and thinks about you.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Nine Four: If one remains steadfast, good fortune will come. Regret will vanish. Friends come and go, reflecting your thoughts.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第四个 "九 "是不分割的，显示出坚定的正确性，这将带来好运，并避免一切悔改的机会。如果主人公的行动不坚定，（只有）他的朋友会追随他的目标。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第四个九，不可分割，表明坚定的正确性，这将带来好运，并防止任何悔改的机会。如果其主题在他的行动中不稳定，（只有）他的朋友才会遵循他的目的。

text.ori_cn: 九五：咸其脢无悔。
text.man_en: The fifth NINE, undivided, shows one moving the flesh along the spine above the heart. There will be no occasion for repentance.

text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第五个“九”，完整的，显示一个人沿着心脏上方的脊柱移动肉体。不会有任何悔改的机会。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九五，贞厉，匪其彭，无咎。

text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第六爻，动分，显示一个人在动自己的下颚和舌头。

text.ori_cn: §恒：亨无咎利贞,利有攸往。
text.man_en: Hang indicates successful progress and no error (in what it denotes). But the advantage will come from being firm and correct; and movement in any direction whatever will be advantageous.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Heng: Heng without blame, Li Ching, Li You You Yi.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Heng: Prosperity has no faults, profit is chastity, profit leads to future success.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Perseverance: Success without blame, favorable to be upright and beneficial to go forward.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 恒表示成功的进展和没有错误（在它所表示的方面）。但是，坚定和正确的态度会带来好处；无论朝哪个方向前进，都会带来好处。

text.man_en2gpt_cn: 亨，表示成功的进展，没有错误（在它所表示的内容中）。但优势将来自坚定和正确；任何方向的行动都会是有利的。

text.ori_cn: 初六：浚恒贞凶无攸利。
text.man_en: The first SIX, divided, shows its subject deeply (desirous) of long continuance. Even with firm correctness there will be evil; there will be no advantage in any way.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The first six: Joon Heng Ching's murderous and unprofitable.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixth day of the lunar month: Jun Heng Zhen is evil but not profitable.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: First Six: Steadfast and upright, there will be misfortune and no advantage.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第一个 "SIX"（分割）表明其主题深深地（渴望）长期持续下去。即使坚定正确，也会有邪恶；不会有任何好处。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 前六首，分开，显示了其主题深刻（渴望）长期持续。即使坚定正确，也会有邪恶；不会有任何优势。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初六，咸其拇，趾之上下，强急无咎。

text.ori_cn: 九二：悔亡。
text.man_en: The second NINE, undivided, shows all occasion for repentance disappearing.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Ninety-two: repentance for death.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-two: Regret.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Second Nine: Regret vanishes.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第二个 "九 "是不分割的，表明所有悔改的机会都消失了。

text.ori_cn: 六五：恒其德贞妇人吉夫子凶。

text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第五个 "SIX"（分割）表示其主体持续保持其所代表的美德。对妻子而言，这将是幸运的；对丈夫而言，这将是不幸的。

text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Six in the fifth place: Regret vanishes, and there will be nothing to worry about. Proceeding brings good fortune, and there will be no misfortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第五个 "六"，分而治之，说明了（从其主题来看）所有悔改的理由是如何消失的。(但）不要担心自己会失败还是成功。前进将是幸运的，在任何方面都是有利的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第五个“六”，分开，显示了所有悔改的机会如何消失（从其主题）。 （但是）让他不要担心自己会失败还是成功。进步将是幸运的，并且在各方面都是有利的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第五爻，分，显示所有悔改的机会都消失了（对于其主体）。（但）不要担心他是否会失败或成功。前进将是吉利的，并且在各方面都有利。

text.ori_cn: 上九：晋其角维用伐邑厉吉无咎贞吝。
text.man_en: The topmost nine undivided, shows one advancing his horns. But he only uses them to punish the (rebellious people of his own) city. The position is perilous, but there will be good fortune. (Yet) however firm and correct he may be, there will be occasion for regret.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Upper nine: Jin its horn Wei with the use of faji Li Ji no blame ching stint.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 9: The Jin Dynasty's Jiaowei used it to conquer the city with great luck and good luck.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Top Nine: Advancing with strength, using force to conquer the city brings danger but ends well without blame, though persistence brings regret.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 最上面的九个未分的，显示出一个正在推进他的角。但他只是用这些角来惩罚（自己城市里的叛逆者）。位置是危险的，但会有好运。(然而）无论他多么坚定正确，都会有后悔的时候。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 最上面的九个完整的，显示其中一个正在推进他的角。但他只是用它们来惩罚（他自己的）城市的叛逆人民。职位虽然危险，但会有好运。 （然而）无论他多么坚定和正确，他都会有后悔的时候。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 上九，见群龙无首，吉。

text.ori_cn: §明夷：利艰贞。
text.man_en: Ming I indicates that (in the circumstances which it denotes) it will be advantageous to realize the difficulty (of the position), and maintain firm correctness.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Mingyi: Good for hardship and chastity.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ming Yi: Li is difficult and honest.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Darkening of the Light: It is beneficial to remain firm and strong in the face of difficulties.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 明一表示，（在它所表示的情况下）认识到（立场的）困难并保持坚定正确是有利的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 明一表示（在其所表示的情况下）认识到（立场的）困难并保持坚定的正确性将是有利的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 《明夷卦》表明，在它所指示的情况下，认识到处境的艰难并保持坚定正确将是有利的。

text.ori_cn: 初九：明夷于飞垂其翼君子于行三日不食有攸往主人有言。
text.man_en: The first NINE, undivided, shows its subject, (in the condition indicated by) Ming I, flying, but with drooping wings. When the superior man (is revolving) his going away, he may be for three days without eating. Wherever he goes, the people there may speak (derisively of him).
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The first nine: Ming Yi in the fly hanging its wings gentleman in the line three days without food there is a need to go to the master has a word.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninth day of the lunar month: The barbarians of the Ming Dynasty are flying and their wings are hanging down. The gentleman is walking for three days without eating. He has something to say to his master.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: First Nine: The bright pheasant flies and lowers its wings; the noble one on the journey does not eat for three days. Wherever he goes, the host has something to say.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第一个九宫格，没有分割，显示其主体，（在明一所表示的状态下）飞行，但翅膀下垂。当高人（旋转）离开时，他可能会三天不吃饭。无论他走到哪里，那里的人都会说（嘲笑他的）话。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 前九，未分割，显示了它的主题，（在由所示的情况下）明一，飞翔，但翅膀下垂。君子走时，可以三日不食。他走到哪里，那里的人都会议论（嘲笑他）。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初九，明夷，飞而不升，羽翮垂。君子以无食三日，得处民以上。

text.ori_cn: 六二：明夷夷于左股用拯马壮吉。
text.man_en: The second SIX, divided, shows its subject, (in the condition indicated by) Ming I, wounded in the left thigh. He saves himself by the strength of a (swift) horse; and is fortunate.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Six two: Ming Yi Yi in the left stock with life-saving Ma Zhuang Ji.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-two: Ming Yiyi uses it on the left thigh to save the horse and make it auspicious.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Line Six Two: The brightness of the hidden light is wounded on the left thigh. With the help of a strong horse, there is fortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第二个 "SIX "被分割开来，显示其主体（明一所表示的状态）左大腿受伤。他凭借一匹（迅捷的）马的力量保住了自己；他是幸运的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第二个“六”，分开，显示了它的主题，（在由所示的情况下）明一，左大腿受伤。他凭借一匹（快）马的力量来拯救自己；并且是幸运的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第二个六，分开，显示其主体，（在明夷所指示的条件下）左大腿受伤。他靠一匹（迅捷的）马的力量自救，并且是幸运的。

text.ori_cn: 九三：明夷于南狩得其大首不可疾贞。
text.man_en: The third NINE, undivided, shows its subject, (in the condition indicated by) Ming I, hunting in the south, and taking the great chief (of the darkness). He should not be eager to make (all) correct (at once).
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine three: Ming Yi in the south hunting to get its big head can not be fast chastity.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-three: The Ming Yi hunted in the south and got its big head.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The third line: The sunbird is wounded on a southern hunt but captures the great leader; do not pursue quickly, stay firm.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第三个 "九 "是不分割的，显示其主体（在明我所表示的状态下）在南方狩猎，并夺取了（黑暗中的）大首领。他不应该急于（一下子）使（一切）正确。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第三个九，不可分割，显示了它的主题，（在由）明一所指示的情况下，在南方狩猎，并夺取了（黑暗中）伟大的酋长。他不应该急于（立即）使（全部）正确。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九三，明夷于南狩，得其大首，不可疾贞。

text.ori_cn: 六四：入于左腹获明夷之心于出门庭。
text.man_en: The fourth SIX, divided, shows its subject (just) entered into the left side of the belly (of the dark land). (But) he is able to carry out the mind appropriate (in the condition indicated by) Ming I, quitting the gate and courtyard (of the lord of darkness).
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: VI.4: Entering the left abdomen to obtain the heart of Mingyi at the exit gate.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-four: Enter the left abdomen and obtain the Ming Yi's Heart in the outer court.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Line Six of the Fourth Hexagram: Upon entering the left side of the abdomen, one gains the heart of Ming Yi upon leaving the courtyard.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第四个 "六"，被分割，显示其主体（刚刚）进入（黑暗之地）的左腹。(但）他能够（在明一所表示的条件下）执行适当的思想，退出（黑暗之主的）大门和庭院。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第四个六，分开，显示其主体（刚刚）进入（黑暗土地）腹部的左侧。 （但）他能以明我所指示的适当心，退出（黑暗之主的）大门和庭院。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第六爻，分开，表示其主体刚刚进入黑暗之地的左侧腹部。然而，他能够在暗示明夷的条件下，按照适当的心意去执行，退出黑暗之主的门庭。

text.ori_cn: 六五：箕子之明夷利贞。
text.man_en: The fifth SIX, divided, shows how the count of Ki fulfilled the condition indicated by Ming I. It will be advantageous to be firm and correct.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Sixth five: the Minozi's Mingyi Lizhen.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-five: Ji Zi’s Ming Yi Li Zhen.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Sixty-Five: The darkening of the light represented by Jizi benefits from perseverance.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第五个 "六"，"分"，说明 "箕 "数如何满足了明 "一 "的条件。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第五六，除，显示气计数如何满足明一所指示的条件。坚定和正确将是有利的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第六爻，分开，显示了计的数量如何满足明夷所指示的条件。保持坚定和正确将会有利。

text.ori_cn: 上六：不明晦初登于天后入于地。
text.man_en: The sixth SIX, divided, shows the case where there is no light, but (only) obscurity. (Its subject) had at first ascended to (the top of) the sky; his future shall be to go into the earth.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Upper Sixth: Unknown obscure first ascending in the heavens and then entering the earth.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 6: Unknown and obscure people ascend to heaven for the first time and then enter the earth.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Top Six: Not understanding the darkness, first rises to the sky, then descends to the earth.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第六个 "六 "是 "分"，表示没有光而（只有）晦暗的情况。(其主体）最初升到（顶端）天空，他的未来将进入大地。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第六个“六”，分开，显示了没有光，但（仅）黑暗的情况。 （它的主题）最初升到了天空（的顶部）；他的未来将是进入地球。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第六爻，分裂，显示没有光明，只有昏暗。（其主角）起初登上了天空；将来他会进入大地。

text.ori_cn: §家人：利女贞。
text.man_en: For (the realization of what is taught in) Kia Zan, (or for the regulation of the family), what is most advantageous is that the wife be firm and correct.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Family members: the Lil' Maiden.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Family: Li Ligustrum.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Family: Ligustrum.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 为了（实现）《嘉赞》中的教导，（或为了管理家庭），最有利的是妻子要坚定而正确。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 为起亚赞（或为治理家庭），最有利的是妻子坚定正确。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 为了实现《伽赞》中的教义（或为了管理家庭），最重要的是妻子要坚定和端正。

text.ori_cn: 初九：闲有家悔亡。
text.man_en: The first NINE, undivided, shows its subject establishing restrictive regulations in his household. Occasions for repentance will disappear.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The first nine days of the year: an idle family repents of its death.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninth day of the lunar month: I have a free family and regret my death.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: First Nine: There is idleness at home, but regret disappears.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第一个 "九 "是不分割的，它显示了主体在家中制定了限制性规定。悔改的机会将会消失。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 前九个完整的，显示其主题在他的家庭中建立限制性规定。悔改的机会将会消失。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初九，不分，表示其主体在家中制定严格规定。悔恨的时机将消失。

text.ori_cn: 六二：无攸遂在中馈贞吉。
text.man_en: The second SIX, divided, shows its subject taking nothing on herself, but in her central place attending to the preparation of the food. Through her firm correctness there will be good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Six Two: No Yousui in the middle of the feed chastity auspicious.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-two: Wu You then presented Zhenji in the middle.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Sixty-two: There is no journey that leads to success in domestic endeavors, but perseverance brings good fortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第二个 "SIX"（分割）显示，它的主体什么也不做，只是在中心位置准备食物。她的坚定正确将带来好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第二个“六”，分开，表明它的主题不关心自己，但在她的中心位置专注于食物的准备。通过她坚定的正确性，将会带来好运。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第二爻，中爻，象征着其主体不主动承揽任何事情，而是身居正中的位置关注着食物的准备。通过她的坚决正确，将会有好的运势。

text.ori_cn: 九三：家人嗃嗃悔厉吉妇子嘻嘻终吝。
text.man_en: The third NINE, undivided, shows its subject (treating) the members of the household with stern severity. There will be occasion for repentance, there will be peril, (but) there will (also) be good fortune. If the wife and children were to be smirking and chattering, in the end there would be occasion for regret.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine-three: family members scolded with severity, and the woman and son were very stingy.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-three: The family regretted it, but Li Ji and his wife ended up being stingy.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Six in the third place: The household members communicate harshly; there is regret and danger. It is auspicious if the woman remains cheerful and the child is carefree, but in the end, there will be shame.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第三个 "九 "是不分割的，显示了它的主题（以严厉的态度对待）家庭成员。会有悔改的机会，会有危险，（但）也会（有）好运。如果妻子和孩子们嬉皮笑脸、喋喋不休，到头来就会后悔莫及。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第三个“九”，完整的，显示了其主题（对待）家庭成员的严厉程度。会有悔改的机会，会有危险，但也会有福气。如果妻子和孩子们傻笑、喋喋不休，到头来还是有遗憾的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九三：家人悔厉，吉。妇子嘻嘻，终吝。

text.ori_cn: 六四：富家大吉。
text.man_en: The fourth SIX, divided, shows its subject enriching the family. There will be great good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: VI.4: Great luck to the rich family.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: June 4th: Good fortune for a rich family.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Line Six: Great fortune for the wealthy family.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第四个 "SIX"（分割）显示其主题是家庭富裕。会有巨大的好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第四个“六”，分开，显示了它的主题是丰富家庭。将会有很大的福气。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 六四，分明，其人使家庭富庶，必有大吉。

text.ori_cn: 九五：王假有家勿恤吉。
text.man_en: The fifth NINE, undivided, shows the influence of the king extending to his family. There need be no anxiety; there will be good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine and a half: the King's leave has a family not to worry about the auspicious.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-five: Don’t worry if the king has a family.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Ninety-five: If the king has no worries about his home, it is auspicious.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第五个 "九 "是不分割的，显示了国王对其家人的影响。不必焦虑，会有好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第五个九，不可分割，显示了国王对其家庭的影响力。不必焦虑；将会有好运。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九五，帝乙归妹，以祉元吉。无忧，有庆幸。

text.ori_cn: 上九：有孚威如终吉。
text.man_en: The topmost NINE, undivided, shows its subject possessed of sincerity and arrayed in majesty. In the end there will be good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Upper 9: Yau Fu Wei as in the end of the auspicious.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: On the ninth page: There is prosperity and majesty, and the end is auspicious.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Top Nine: There is sincerity and an imposing presence; it ends well.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 最上面的 "九 "字，没有分割，显示出主体的真诚和威严。最终会有好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 最上面的“九”，完整无缺，显示其主题真诚而威严。最终会有好运。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 上九，持有诚意，庄严的姿态。最终会有好运。

text.ori_cn: §睽：小事吉。
text.man_en: Khwei indicates that, (notwithstanding the condition of things which it denotes), in small matters there will (still) be good success.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Parting: small things are auspicious.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Jui: Small things are auspicious.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Separation: Minor matters are auspicious.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 克威表示，（尽管它所表示的是事物的状况），在小事上（仍然）会取得良好的成功。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: Khwei 表示，（尽管它所表示的事物的状况如何），在小事情上（仍然）会取得很好的成功。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 咸卦表示，尽管它所象征的情势如何，在小事上仍将会有好的结果。

text.ori_cn: 初九：悔亡丧马勿逐自复见恶人无咎。
text.man_en: The first NINE, undivided, shows that (to its subject) occasion for repentance will disappear. He has lost his horses, but let him not seek for them; they will return of themselves. Should he meet with bad men, he will not err (in communicating with them).
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: 初九：repentance death loss of horses do not expel from the self-recovery to see the evil people without blame.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninth day of the lunar month: If you regret your death and lost your horse, don’t chase yourself away again. If you see evil people, you won’t be blamed.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: First Nine: Regret vanishes, losing a horse yet not pursuing it; it will return on its own. Seeing bad people brings no blame.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第一个 "九"，没有分割，表明（对其主题而言）悔改的机会将消失。他失去了他的马，但他不要去寻找它们，它们会自己回来的。如果他遇到坏人，他（在与他们交流时）不会犯错。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 前九个完整的，表明（对其主题而言）悔改的机会将消失。他失去了马匹，但不要让他去找；他们会自己回来。如果遇到坏人，他不会犯错。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初九，不远复，无悔。失马，勿逐，自复。见恶人，无咎。

text.ori_cn: 九二：遇主于巷无咎。
text.man_en: The second NINE, undivided, shows its subject happening to meet with his lord in a byepassage. There will be no error.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine two: meet the Lord in the alley without blame.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-two: There is no fault in meeting the master in the alley.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Ninety-two: Meeting the master in the alley, no blame.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第二个九宫格，没有分割，表现的是主人公在旁路偶遇。这不会出错。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第二个《九》是完整的，表现了它的主题碰巧在一条旁道与他的主人会面。不会有错误。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第二个九，未分开的，显示其主体在小路上遇到他的主公。不会有错误。

text.ori_cn: 六三：见舆曳其牛掣其人天且劓无初有终。
text.man_en: In the third SIX, divided, we see one whose carriage is dragged back, while the oxen in it are pushed back, and he is himself subjected to the shaving of his head and the cutting off of his nose. There is no good beginning, but there will be a good end.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Sixth three: see the mikoshi drags its oxen and switches its people to the sky and wakes up without a beginning and an end.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-three: Seeing a man dragging his oxen and dragging his body, heaven and earth have no beginning and end.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Six Three: To see the carriage being drawn but the ox pulling back and the man being struggled against, is to foresee hardship and mutilation at the beginning but eventual success at the end.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在第三个 "六 "中，我们看到一个人的马车被拖了回来，牛也被推了回来，而他自己则被剃了光头，鼻子也被割掉了。没有好的开始，但会有好的结局。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在第三个六分中，我们看到一个人的马车被拖了回来，而车里的牛也被推了回来，而他自己也被剃了头，割了鼻子。没有好的开始，但一定会有好的结局。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在第六爻位，我们看到一个人的车被拉回去，而车内的牛也被推回去，他本人还被剃去头发和割掉鼻子。起初没有好的开始，但最终会有好的结局。

text.ori_cn: 九四：睽孤遇元夫交孚厉无咎。
text.man_en: The fourth NINE, undivided, shows its subject solitary amidst the (prevailing) disunion. (But) he meets with the good man (represented by the first line), and they blend their sincere desires together. The position is one of peril, but there will be no mistake.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine-four: The parting of the solitary meets the Yuanfujiao Fu Li without any blame.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 94: Lonely ex-husband with no guilt.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Nine Four: Divergence and solitude meet the noble one; sincere mutual trust eliminates misfortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第四行 "九 "是不分割的，它显示了主体在（普遍的）不和中的孤独。(但是）他遇到了好人（由第一行代表），他们将真诚的愿望融合在一起。虽然处境危险，但不会有错。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第四个《九》，完整的，显示了它的主题在（普遍的）分裂中的孤独。 （但是）他遇到了好人（第一行代表），他们将真诚的愿望融合在一起。这一立场是危险的，但不会有任何错误。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九四，独处在（普遍的）离散之中。（但）他遇到了（第一爻所代表的）善人，并使他们的诚挚愿望融合在一起。这个位置危险，但不会有差错。

text.ori_cn: 六五：悔亡厥宗噬肤往何咎。
text.man_en: The fifth SIX, divided, shows that (to its subject) occasion for repentance will disappear. With his relative (and minister he unites closely and readily) as if he were biting through a piece of skin. When he goes forward (with this help), what error can there be?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Sixty-five: Repentance for the loss of the clan and the devouring of the skin to what is to blame.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-Five: Regret over the death of Jue Zong and why he is to blame for eating his skin.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Six Five: Regret vanishes, his lineage bites into his flesh. Where is the blame in proceeding?
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第五个 "六"，"分"，表明（对其主体而言）悔改的机会将消失。他与他的亲戚（和大臣）紧密地结合在一起，就像他咬破了一块皮。当他（在这种帮助下）前进时，还会有什么错误呢？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第五个六，分开，表明（对其主题而言）悔改的机会将消失。他与他的亲戚（以及他的大臣）紧密而轻松地团结在一起，就像咬破了一块皮肤一样。当他前进的时候（有这个帮助），还能有什么错误呢？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第六爻，分裂象，表示悔改的机会将会消失。他与他的亲属（和部长密切联系）就像咬破一块皮。当他在这种帮助下前行时，怎么会有错呢？

text.ori_cn: 上九：睽孤见豕负涂载鬼一车先张之弧后说之弧匪寇婚媾往遇雨则吉。
text.man_en: The topmost NINE, undivided, shows its subject solitary amidst the (prevailing) disunion. (In the subject of the third line, he seems to) see a pig bearing on its back a load of mud, (or fancies) there is a carriage full of ghosts. He first bends his bow against him, and afterwards unbends it, (for he discovers) that he is not an assailant to injure, but a near relative. Going forward, he shall meet with (genial) rain, and there will be good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Upper Nine: The separation of the solitary see the boar loaded with a ghost of a car first Zhang's arc and then said the arc of the bandits and invaders marriage coitus to the rain will be auspicious.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 9: When I see a pig carrying a ghost in a carriage, I will first draw the arc and then tell the story of the bandits and bandits going to get married. If it rains, it will be auspicious.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Upper Nine: In separation, one sees a pig covered in mud, a cart carrying ghosts, a bow drawn before, a bow relaxed afterward. Not robbers, but a wedding. Going out and encountering rain is auspicious.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 最上面的 "九 "字，没有分割，在（普遍的）不和中显示出其主体的孤独。(在第三行的主题中，他似乎）看到一头猪背上背着一担泥，（或者幻想）有一辆装满鬼魂的马车。他先是弯弓对着他，后来又松开了，（因为他发现）他不是要伤害的攻击者，而是一个近亲。向前走，会遇到（和煦的）雨水，会有好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 最上面的九个，完整的，显示了它的主题在（普遍的）分裂中孤独。 （在第三行的主题中，他似乎）看到一头猪背上驮着泥土，（或者幻想）有一辆车子装满了鬼。他先把弓对着他，然后又拉开，（因为他发现）他不是一个要伤害的攻击者，而是一个近亲。往后必遇雨，有福气。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 上九，贞孤遇离。见豕负涂，载鬼一车。先张弓，后解之。非攻于伤，而近于戚。往遇甘雨，吉。

text.ori_cn: §蹇：利西南不利东北利见大人贞吉。
text.man_en: In (the state indicated by) Kien advantage will be found in the southwest, and the contrary in the northeast. It will be advantageous (also) to meet with the great man. (In these circumstances), with firmness and correctness, there will be good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Jian: favourable southwest unfavourable north-east favourable to see the Lord Ching-kit.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Jian: It is beneficial to the southwest and unfavorable to the northeast. It is beneficial to see the Lord Zhenji.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Difficulty: Favorable to the southwest, unfavorable to the northeast. Beneficial to meet a great person. Perseverance brings good fortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在（基恩所代表的国家）西南方有利，东北方不利。与伟人相会也是有利的。(在这种情况下），只要坚定正确，就会有好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在Kien（表示的州）中，西南部会发现优势，而东北部则相反。与伟人会面也是有利的。 （在这种情况下）只要坚定正确，就会有福气。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在乾的状态下，南西方会找到优势，而东北方则相反。也会有利于与伟人相遇。（在这种情况下），坚守正道会有好的运气。

text.ori_cn: 初六：往蹇来誉。
text.man_en: From the first SIX, divided, we learn that advance (on the part of its subject) will lead to (greater) difficulties, while remaining stationary will afford ground for praise.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The sixth day of the month: the reputation of the past.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The sixth day of the lunar month: Go and pay tribute.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: First Six: Moving forward with difficulty will bring praise in return.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 从第一个 "SIX"，即 "分 "中，我们了解到（主体）前进会导致（更大的）困难，而静止不动则会带来赞美。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 从前六个，分开，我们了解到，前进（就其主体而言）将导致（更大的）困难，而保持静止将提供赞扬的理由。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 从初六爻的爻辞中，我们知道进攻将带来更大的困难，而保持静止则值得称赞。

text.ori_cn: 六二：王臣蹇蹇匪躬之故。
text.man_en: The second SIX, divided, shows the minister of the king struggling with difficulty on difficulty, and not with a view to his own advantage.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: VI.2: The king's ministers are not good enough to take care of themselves.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-two: The reason why the king and his ministers bowed to the bandits.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Line 62: The loyal minister, due to his own endeavors, is unblemished.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第二个 "SIX"（分裂）表明国王的大臣在困难中挣扎，而不是为了自己的利益。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第二个“六”，分开，表现了国王的大臣在困难中挣扎，而不是为了自己的利益。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第二爻，六，分开显示了国王的大臣困难重重地在斗争，不是为了自己的利益。

text.ori_cn: 九三：往蹇来反。
text.man_en: The third NINE, undivided, shows its subject advancing, (but only) to (greater) difficulties. He remains stationary, and returns (to his former associates).
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine-three: the past is unfavourable, and the future is unfavourable.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-three: Go back and forth.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Nine in the third place means: Difficult progress, but a return is possible.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第三个 "九 "是不分割的，它显示了主体在前进，（但只是）遇到（更大的）困难。他保持静止，（回到他以前的伙伴身边）。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第三个九，完整的，显示了它的主题前进，（但只是）到（更大的）困难。他保持静止，然后返回（回到他以前的同事那里）。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九三，不久，中息困难。君子居正，则回命，复其初也。

text.ori_cn: 六四：往蹇来连。
text.man_en: The fourth SIX, divided, shows its subject advancing, (but only) to (greater) difficulties. He remains stationary, and unites (with the subject of the line above).
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Six-four: the past is not good, and the future is not good.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-four: Go back and forth.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Sixth four: Advancing is difficult, but retreating brings connection.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第四行 "SIX "被分割开来，显示其主体在前进，（但只是）遇到（更大的）困难。他静止不动，（与上面一行的主体）结合在一起。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第四个“六”，分开，表明其主题正在前进，（但只是）面临（更大的）困难。他保持静止，并结合在一起（与上面一行的主题）。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第四爻，初六，象征着其主体前进，(但只会迎来更大的)困难。他保持原位，并与（上一爻的主体）联合。

text.ori_cn: 九五：大蹇朋来。
text.man_en: The fifth NINE, undivided, shows its subject struggling with the greatest difficulties, while friends are coming to help him.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine-five: the big cripple ponies come.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-five: Big Jian Peng comes.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Nine Five: Great difficulty with the coming of friends.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第五部《九》是不分割的，表现的是主人公在最大的困难中挣扎，而朋友们正赶来帮助他。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第五部《九》，完整地展现了主人公在最大的困难中挣扎，而朋友们却来帮助他。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第九、九不变，显示其主体在与巨大的困难斗争，而朋友们正在来帮助他。

text.ori_cn: 上六：往蹇来硕吉利见大人。
text.man_en: The topmost SIX, divided, shows its subject going forward, (only to increase) the difficulties, while his remaining stationary will be (productive of) great (merit). There will be good fortune, and it will be advantageous to meet with the great man.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Previous 6: Go to Jian Lai Shuo Ji Li to see the Lord.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 6: Go to Jian Lai to see the Lord with great auspiciousness.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Top six: Going forward with difficulty but gaining great advantages, it is auspicious to meet a great person.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 最上面的 "六 "字被分割开来，显示其主体向前走，（只会增加）困难，而他保持静止不动，将（产生）巨大的（功绩）。会有好运，与伟人相遇也是有利的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 最上面的六人，分开，表明其主题前进，（只会增加）困难，而他保持静止将（产生）巨大（优点）。会有福气，有利会见伟人。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 上九，贞恶，暂停，厉得，大人见，吉。

text.ori_cn: §解：利西南无所往其来复吉有攸往夙吉。
text.man_en: In (the state indicated by) Kieh advantage will be found in the southwest. If no (further) operations be called for, there will be good fortune in coming back (to the old conditions). If some operations be called for, there will be good fortune in the early conducting of them.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Solution: The south-west of the country has nothing to go to its come back to the auspicious there is a long time to go to the auspicious.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Explanation: Benefit from the southwest and have nowhere to go. It comes and returns good luck, but you go to the old good luck.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Interpretation: If there is no place to go to the southwest, returning brings good fortune. If there is somewhere to go, it will bring early good fortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在（Kieh 所表示的状态）西南方会有优势。如果不需要（进一步）行动，回到（以前的状态）会有好运。如果需要采取一些行动，尽早进行会有好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在（由所示的州）Kieh的优势将在西南部被发现。如果不需要（进一步的）手术，那么（回到原来的条件）将会有好运。如果需要进行某些手术，尽早进行将会有好运。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 处于契的状态时，将在西南方向找到有利条件。如果不再有进一步的行动，回到旧的状态会有好的运气。如果有些行动是必要的，尽早执行会有好的运气。

text.ori_cn: 初六：无咎。
text.man_en: The first SIX, divided, shows that its subject will commit no error.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: First six: no blame.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The sixth day of the lunar month: no blame.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: First six: No blame.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第一个 "SIX"（分割）表明其主体不会犯错。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 前六分，表明其主体不会犯错误。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初六，分裂，象征其主体不会犯错。

text.ori_cn: 九二：田获三狐得黄矢贞吉。
text.man_en: The second NINE, undivided, shows its subject catch, in hunting, three foxes, and obtain the yellow (=golden) arrows. With firm correctness there will be good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine-two: The three foxes in the field get the yellow veil of chastity and good fortune.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-two: Tian wins three foxes and wins Huang Yazhenji.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Line 92: In the field, three foxes were caught; obtaining a yellow arrow brings upright good fortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第二个 "九 "是不分割的，表示主人公在打猎时捕捉到三只狐狸，并获得黄色（=金色）的箭。只要坚定正确，就会有好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第二个九，完整，显示其主题在狩猎中捕获三只狐狸，并获得黄色（=金色）箭头。坚定正确就会有好运。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初六，无妾三狐，得黄矢。贞吉。

text.ori_cn: 六三：负且乘致寇至贞吝。
text.man_en: The third SIX, divided, shows a porter with his burden, (yet) riding in a carriage. He will (only) tempt robbers to attack him. However firm and correct he may (try to) be, there will be cause for regret.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Sixth three: Negative and multiply to the Kou to Ching stingy.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-three: Negative and multiplied, the enemy will become chaste and stingy.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Sixty Three: Bearing a burden while riding, robbers will arrive, leading to distress if one persists in righteousness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第三个 "SIX"（分割）显示的是一个挑着担子的搬运工，（却）坐着马车。他（只会）引诱强盗袭击他。无论他（试图）多么坚定和正确，都会有后悔的理由。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第三个“六”，分开，展示了一个搬运工带着他的负担，（但）骑在马车上。他（只会）引诱强盗攻击他。无论他（试图）多么坚定和正确，都会有理由后悔。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第三爻，分隔的，显示一个挑着担子但坐在车里的搬运工。他只会引诱强盗袭击他。无论他多么努力保持坚定和正确，都会有后悔的原因。

text.ori_cn: 九四：解而拇朋至斯孚。
text.man_en: (To the subject of) the fourth NINE, undivided, (it is said), ‘Remove your toes. Friends will (then) come, between you and whom there will be mutual confidence. '
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine-four: The solution and thumbs up to Sifu.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-four: Solution and Thumb Peng to Sifu.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Ninety-four: When it dissolves, the knots of friendship are cemented in trust.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: (对）第四个 "九 "的主体，不分割的，（说）'去掉你的脚趾。朋友（就会）来了，你们之间会相互信任。'
text.man_en2ggl_cn: （针对）第四个九，不可分割，（据说），“移开你的脚趾。”朋友将会到来，你和他们之间将会有相互的信任。 '
text.man_en2gpt_cn: (至九四，不变)，曰：‘除去你的脚趾。朋友们会来，到那时你们之间会有互相信任。’

text.ori_cn: 六五：君子维有解吉有孚于小人。
text.man_en: The fifth SIX, divided, shows (its subject), the superior man (=the ruler), executing his function of removing (whatever is injurious to the idea of the hexagram), in which case there will be good fortune, and confidence in him will be shown even by the small men.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Sixth Five: The gentleman has to solve the problem with a good fortune and a bad fortune in the small man.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-Five: A gentleman maintains good fortune and is good at villains.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Hexagram 65: The gentleman is always able to resolve things auspiciously and has trust among the common people.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第五爻 "离 "表示（其主体）上位者（=统治者）执行其消除（任何有损于爻辞思想的事物）的职能，在这种情况下将会有好运，即使是小人物也会对他表示信任。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第五六，分，显示（其主体）君子（=统治者）执行其消除功能（任何对卦的思想有害的东西），在这种情况下，将会有福气，并且对即使是小人物也会向他展示。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第六爻（位于最上），示上人生用去除（对卦象有害的东西）的职能，这样就会有好运，而即使是小人也会对他表示信任。

text.ori_cn: 上六：公用射隼于高墉之上获之无不利。
text.man_en: In the sixth SIX, divided, we see a feudal prince (with his bow) shooting at a falcon on the top of a high wall, and hitting it. (The effect of his action) will be in every way advantageous.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Upper Sixth: The public use of a falcon to shoot at a high city wall is not detrimental to the acquisition of a falcon.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 6: The public falcon was captured on Gaoyong without any disadvantage.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Top six: The duke shoots a falcon on high walls and captures it without any disadvantage.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在第六首 "分 "中，我们看到一位封建王朝的王子（用弓箭）射向高墙顶上的猎鹰，并击中了它。(他的行动的效果）在各方面都将是有利的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在第六部《六分》中，我们看到一位封建王子（用他的弓）射向高墙顶部的一只猎鹰，并击中了它。 （他的行动的效果）在各方面都是有利的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初六，分裂，我们看到一位封建诸侯（拿着他的弓）射击墙头上的隼，并且命中目标。（他的行为的效果）将是无比有利的。

text.ori_cn: §损：有孚元吉无咎可贞利有攸往曷之用二簋可用享。
text.man_en: In (what is denoted by) Sun, if there be sincerity (in him who employs it), there will be great good fortune: freedom from error; firmness and correctness that can be maintained; and advantage in every movement that shall be made. In what shall this (sincerity in the exercise of Sun) be employed? (Even) in sacrifice two baskets of grain, (though there be nothing else), may be presented.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Loss: There is a good fortune, no blame can be chaste, and there is a good way to go where the use of two gui can be enjoyed.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Loss: If you have fortune and good luck, you can have chastity and benefit, and you can go to Huo and use the two guis to enjoy.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Loss: With sincerity, great good fortune and no misfortune. It is possible to persevere. It is beneficial to have a goal to pursue. What should be used? Two bowls can be used for offerings.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在（太阳所表示的）方面，如果（运用太阳的）人有诚意，就会有很大的好运：不会出错；能够保持坚定和正确；在所做的每一个动作中都有优势。这（行使太阳的诚意）可以用在什么地方呢？(甚至）在祭祀时，也可以献上两筐谷物（尽管没有其他东西）。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在太阳（所代表的），如果有诚意（在使用它的人身上），就会有大福：远离错误；可保持的坚定性和正确性；并在每一个动作中发挥优势。此（日行之诚）何用？ （甚至）祭祀时，可以献上两筐谷物（虽然没有别的东西）。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在‘巽’——如果使用它的人有诚实之心，就会有极大的福气：免于错误；能够保持坚韧而正确的态度；而且每一个行动都有利。在哪里应该运用这种（巽之诚实）？（即使在祭祀中），两篮谷物（虽然没有其他东西）也可以奉献。

text.ori_cn: 初九：已事遄往无咎酌损之。
text.man_en: The first NINE, undivided, shows its subject suspending his own affairs, and hurrying, away (to help the subject of the fourth line). He will commit no error, but let him consider how far he should contribute of what is his (for the other).
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The first nine: has been the matter of Trent to no blame discretionary loss.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninth day of the lunar month: Whatever has happened has gone away without any blame.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: First Nine: If things have come to an end, hasten forward without fault and consider reducing it.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第一个九行，没有分割，表明其主体暂停自己的事务，匆匆离开（去帮助第四行的主体）。他不会犯错，但让他考虑一下，他应该在多大程度上（为他人）贡献自己的力量。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 前九行，未分开，表明其主题暂停了自己的事务，并匆忙离开（以帮助第四行的主题）。他不会犯错误，但让他考虑一下他应该为他的（为他人）贡献多少。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初九，勿用，其往无咎，荐之用，允也。

text.ori_cn: 九二：利贞征凶弗损益之。
text.man_en: The second NINE, undivided, shows that it will be advantageous for its subject to maintain a firm correctness, and that action on his part will be evil. He can give increase (to his correlate) without taking from himself.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Ninety-two: The Li-Ching signs of evil Fo loss and gain.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-Two: Benefit and Zhen conquer evil, but it is not a gain or loss.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Ninety-two: Advantageous to remain correct, fortune in persevering, without loss or gain.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第二个 "九 "是不分割的，它表明主体保持坚定的正确性是有利的，而他的行为则是有害的。他可以（给他的相关者）增加，而不从自己身上拿走。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第二个九，不可分割，表明其主体保持坚定的正确性将是有利的，而他的行为将是邪恶的。他可以在不从自己身上夺走的情况下给予（他的相关者）增加。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初九，阳爻，象征着守住正道将会带来好处，而行动则会带来不利。他不需损失自己便能增益他人。

text.ori_cn: 六三：三人行则损一人一人行则得其友。
text.man_en: The third SIX, divided, shows how of three men walking together, the number is diminished by one; and how one, walking, finds his friend.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: VI.3: If three people walk together, they will lose one person; if one person walks together, he will gain his friend.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-three: If three people go together, one person will lose. If one person goes alone, he will gain his friends.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Line Six in the Third Hexagram: When three are traveling together, one will be lost; when one travels alone, one will gain a friend.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第三个 "SIX"（除法）表示三个人走在一起，人数减少了一个；一个人走着走着，找到了他的朋友。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第三个“六”，分开，表示三个人同行，数量减一；以及一个人如何步行找到他的朋友。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 六三，众行，伪人减一人，其行遇友。

text.ori_cn: 六四：损其疾使遄有喜无咎。
text.man_en: The fourth SIX, divided, shows its subject diminishing the ailment under which he labors by making (the subject of the first line) hasten (to his help), and make him glad. There will be no error.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: VI.4: The loss of his illness makes Trent happy and blameless.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-Four: Damage to his illness makes Trent happy and blameless.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Hexagram 64: Diminish his illness, hastening his joy without blame.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第四行 "SIX"（分句）表明，它的主体通过让（第一行的主体）赶紧（来帮助他）来减轻他所遭受的痛苦，并让他感到高兴。没有错误。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第四个“六”，分开，表明其主题通过使（第一行的主题）加速（帮助他）并让他高兴来减轻他所受的疾病。不会有错误。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第四条六，分，显示其主体通过使（第一行的主体）赶快（去帮他），使他高兴，减少了他所受的病痛。不会有错误。

text.ori_cn: 六五：或益之十朋之龟弗克违元吉。
text.man_en: The fifth SIX, divided, shows parties adding to (the stores of) its subject ten pairs of tortoise shells, and accepting no refusal. There will be great good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Sixty-five: or benefit of the ten pals of the tortoise Fok defied Yuan Ji.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-five: It may be beneficial to the ten friends, but the turtle will be unlucky.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Sixty-five: Or gaining as much fortune as ten friends cannot defy the great auspiciousness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第五个 "SIX"（分割）表示当事人向其对象增加了十对龟甲，并且不接受任何拒绝。会有很大的好运气。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第五张“六”，显示各方向其主题（的存储）添加十对龟甲，并且不接受拒绝。将会有很大的福气。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第六爻，如果将它分开来看，会看到各方都为主体增添十对龟甲，并且毫不拒绝。这将带来大吉。

text.ori_cn: 上九：弗损益之无咎贞吉利有攸往得臣无家。
text.man_en: The topmost NINE, undivided, shows its subject giving increase to others without taking from himself. There will be no error. With firm correctness there will be good fortune. There will be advantage in every movement that shall be made. He will find ministers more than can be counted by their clans.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Upper nine: Fo loss and gain of no blame chastity and auspicious li you have to go to get the minister no home.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 9: There is no blame for loss or gain, chastity and auspiciousness will lead to success, and the ministers will have no home.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Sixth Nine: Without damage or benefit, there is no blame. Firmness and rectitude bring good fortune. It is advantageous to proceed and obtain loyal followers, though without a settled home.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 最上面的 "九 "是不分割的，表示主体给别人增加，而不从自己那里拿走。没有错误。只要坚定正确，就会有好运。每一次行动都会带来好处。他将发现大臣们的数量远远超过他们的宗族。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 最上面的九个，完整的，表明它的主题是为他人增加而不从自己身上夺取。不会有错误。坚定正确就会有好运。所做的每一个动作都会有优势。他会找到比他们的家族多得多的大臣。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 上九，无咎，弗损益之。贞吉，有攸往，利见大人，不家食吉，睽孤无咎。以上升为他人增加，而不损耗自己。坚定正确，吉祥，历次行动都会有利。将会找到不少于其族数的臣子。

text.ori_cn: §益：利有攸往利涉大川。
text.man_en: Y? indicates that (in the state which it denotes) there will be advantage in every movement which shall be undertaken, that it will be advantageous (even) to cross the great stream.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Benefit: There is a benefit to be gained from the benefit of a great river.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Benefit: There is benefit in going to the great river.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Benefit: There is value in proceeding with a journey, as it brings advantages when crossing great rivers.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: Y "表示（在它所代表的状态中）每一次行动都会有好处，（甚至）跨越大河也会有好处。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 是吗？表明（在它所表示的状态下）将进行的每一个动作都会有优势，（甚至）穿越大溪流将是有利的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: Y? 指出，在它所表示的状态中，进行的任何行动都会有利，即使是渡过大河也会有利。

text.ori_cn: 初九：利用为大作元吉无咎。
text.man_en: The first NINE, undivided, shows that it will be advantageous for its subject in his position to make a great movement. If it be greatly fortunate, no blame will be imputed to him.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: 初九：利用为大作元吉无咎。
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninth day of the lunar month: Use it for great success and no blame.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: First line: Using resources for a great endeavor brings supreme fortune and no blame.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第一个 "九 "是不分割的，它表明，对于它的主体来说，在他所处的位置上进行一次伟大的运动是有利的。如果大吉大利，就不会受到责备。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 前九，不可分割，表明它的主题在他的位置上做出一个伟大的运动将是有利的。如果运气好的话，就不会怪罪他了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初九，不犯放越，则利于其所在之位置而行大事；若大幸，则毋咎。

text.ori_cn: 六二：或益之十朋之龟弗克违永贞吉王用享于帝吉。
text.man_en: The second SIX, divided, shows parties adding to the stores of its subject ten pairs of tortoise shells whose oracles cannot be opposed. Let him persevere in being firm and correct, and there will be good fortune. Let the king, (having the virtues thus distinguished), employ them in presenting his offerings to God, and there will be good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Six two: or benefit of the ten peng of the tortoise Fok against Yongzhen Ji Wang used to enjoy in the emperor Ji.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-two: Perhaps the Turtle Fu Ke of Shi Peng will violate Yongzhenji and the king will use it to enjoy the emperor's auspiciousness.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Sixty-two: Whether it grants the benefit of a turtle worth ten times ten coins, it cannot be contravened. Eternal steadfastness brings good fortune. The king offers sacrifices to the divine, and this is auspicious.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第二个 "SIX "是分割的，表示当事人在其对象的仓库中增加了十对龟甲，而这些龟甲的神谕是无法对抗的。让他坚持坚定和正确，就会有好运。让国王（拥有这样的美德）用它们来向神献祭，就会有好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第二个六，分开，显示各方向其主题的商店添加了十对龟甲，其神谕无法反对。让他坚持坚定、正确，就会有好运。让国王（拥有如此杰出的美德）用它们来向上帝献祭，就会有好运。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第二爻，六阴爻，显示各方在为其主体增加存储量，添加十对不可违抗的龟甲卜卦。让他坚持坚定和正确，必有大吉。让国王（具有如此卓越的美德）用这些龟甲作为向上帝献祭品的仪式，必有大吉。

text.ori_cn: 六三：益之用凶事无咎有孚中行告公用圭。
text.man_en: The third SIX, divided, shows increase given to its subject by means of what is evil, so that he shall (be led to good), and be without blame. Let him be sincere and pursue the path of the Mean, (so shall he secure the recognition of the ruler, like) an officer who announces himself to his prince by the symbol of his rank.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Six Three: Benefit of the use of the evil things without blame Yufu in the line of suing the public Gui.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-three: It is beneficial to use evil things without blame, and Fu Zhongxing tells Gonggui.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Six Three: When benefiting from a misfortune, there is no blame. If there is trust, proceed in the middle course and inform the ruler using a jade tablet.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第三个 "六"，"分"，"增"，"加"，"增 "的意思是 "增加"，"加 "的意思是 "增加"。让他真诚地追求中庸之道，（这样他就会得到君主的认可，就像）一个官员用他的官阶象征向他的王子宣布自己一样。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第三个六，分开，显示通过邪恶的方式增加其臣民，以便他将（被引导到善），并且没有责备。诚心而行中庸之道，如大夫以爵位向君报明。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 六三：不惧凶邪，只要能将心比心，持中守正，必无过错。有如官员谒见君主，手持信物，表明身份。

text.ori_cn: 六四：中行告公从利用为依迁国。
text.man_en: The fourth SIX, divided, shows its subject pursuing the due course. His advice to his prince is followed. He can with advantage be relied on in such a movement as that of removing the capital.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: VI.4: Zhongxing sued the public from the use of the country for Yiqian.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: June 4th: The Bank of China told the public to move to the country based on the use of the government.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: 64: The Bank of China announces the public migration relying on the national move.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第四个 "SIX "被分割开来，显示出其主题正在进行应有的进程。他对王子的建议得到了采纳。在迁都这样的行动中，他是值得信赖的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第四个“六”，分开，显示其主题追求适当的路线。他对王子的建议被采纳了。在迁都这样的运动中，他是可以信赖的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第四爻，变爻，象征着其主体遵循正道。他的建议被君王采纳。在像迁都这样的行动中，他是可以被信赖的。

text.ori_cn: 九五：有孚惠心勿问元吉有孚惠我德。
text.man_en: The fifth NINE, undivided, shows its subject with sincere heart seeking to benefit (all below). There need be no question about it; the result will be great good fortune. (All below) will with sincere heart acknowledge his goodness.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine Five: Yau Fu Hui Xin Do not ask Yuan Ji Yau Fu Hui I De.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-five: If you have Fu Hui, don’t ask about Yuan Ji. If Fu Hui has my virtue.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The ninety-five: If there is sincerity, kindness, and no inquiry, it will be greatly auspicious. If there is sincerity, it benefits my virtue.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第五个 "九 "是不分割的，表明其主体怀着一颗真诚的心寻求利益（以下皆是如此）。这一点毋庸置疑，其结果将是大吉大利。(下同）将以真诚之心承认他的善意。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第五九，不分，显其主诚心求利（下皆）。这是毫无疑问的。结果将是巨大的好运。 （下同）会以诚心承认他的善良。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九五，志存诚求以济众，无咎，其得大吉，众心诚服。

text.ori_cn: 上九：莫益之或击之立心勿恒凶。
text.man_en: In the sixth NINE, undivided, we see one to whose increase none will contribute, while many will seek to assail him. He observes no regular rule in the ordering of his heart. There will be evil.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The upper nine: Mo Yi's or strikes the heart of the establishment do not constant fierce.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 9: Don’t benefit or attack them. Don’t be persistent in doing evil.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Top Nine: Not benefitting it or attacking it, if the mind is not steadfast, it will be inauspicious.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在第六个 "九 "中，我们看到一个人，没有人会为他的成长出力，而许多人却会试图攻击他。他的内心没有规律可循。会有邪恶。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在第六个九，不可分割的情况下，我们看到一个人的增长没有人会做出贡献，而许多人会试图攻击他。他的内心秩序没有遵循任何规律。会有邪恶。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在第六个九，未分开的九，我们看到一个没有人会为他的增长做出贡献，而很多人会试图攻击他。他不遵循心中的常规法则。会有不好的结果。

text.ori_cn: §夬：扬于王庭孚号有厉告自邑不利即戎利有攸往。
text.man_en: Kwai requires (in him who would fulfill its meaning) the exhibition (of the culprit's guilt) in the royal court, and a sincere and earnest appeal (for sympathy and support), with a consciousness of the peril (involved in cutting off the criminal). He should (also) make announcement in his own city, and show that it will not be well to have recourse at once to arms. (In this way) there will be advantage in whatever he shall go forward to.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Resoluteness: the king's court is in a position to tell him that he is not in favour of the Rong, and that he is in the right place to do so.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 夬: Raised in the king's court, the title of "Fu" is used to warn that the city is unfavorable, that is, the military will be successful.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Guai: Proclaim in the royal court that reliance on a name carries danger; informing from the city is unfavorable. Engaging in warfare is not beneficial, but there is advantage in pursuing one's objectives.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 葵要求（履行其含义的人）在王室展示（罪犯的罪行），并诚恳恳切地呼吁（同情和支持），同时意识到（斩杀罪犯所涉及的）危险。他（还）应该在自己的城市发布公告，表明立即诉诸武力是不可取的。(这样）无论他采取什么行动，都会有好处。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 葵要求（在他身上实现其意义）在宫廷中展示（罪犯的罪行），并真诚而恳切地呼吁（同情和支持），并意识到危险（涉及切断罪犯） ）。他（还）应该在自己的城市发表声明，并表明立即诉诸武力是不好的。 （这样）他无论做什么都会有好处。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 夬卦要求（行其义者）在王庭上展示（罪犯的罪行），并真诚而认真地呼吁（同情和支持），意识到（切断罪犯的）危险。他（也）应该在自己的城市宣布，并表明立即动武是不好的。（这样）他无论前行到哪里都会有利。

text.ori_cn: 初九：壮于前趾往不胜为咎。
text.man_en: The first NINE, undivided, shows its subject in (the pride of) strength advancing with his toes. He goes forward, but will not succeed. There will be ground for blame.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The first nine: strong in front of the toe to not win for the blame.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: On the ninth day of the lunar month: If you are stronger than the front toe, you will be blamed.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: First Nine: If you advance boldly without considering your capabilities, you will invite trouble.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第一个 "九 "是不分割的，表现了主体在（骄傲的）力量中用脚尖前进。他前进了，但不会成功。有理由责备他。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 前九个完整的，通过他的脚趾前进的力量（的骄傲）展示了它的主题。他前进，但不会成功。这是有理由受到指责的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初九，潜龙勿用。履之往，强而不成，有咎。

text.ori_cn: 九二：惕号莫夜有戎勿恤。
text.man_en: The second NINE, undivided, shows its subject full of apprehension and appealing (for sympathy and help). Late at night hostile measures may be (taken against him), but he need not be anxious about them.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Jiuji: Tigsuo mo night have rong do not be afraid.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-Two: Be careful and don’t worry if there are soldiers at night.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Ninety-two: Be cautious, do not sound alarms at night, there might be enemies; do not worry.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第二个 "九 "是不分割的，它表明它的主题充满忧虑，并呼吁（同情和帮助）。深夜可能会有人（对他）采取敌对措施，但他不必为此焦虑。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第二个九，完整地显示了其主题充满忧虑和呼吁（同情和帮助）。深夜可能会采取敌对措施，但他不必为此担心。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第二爻，初九，表示其人充满了忧虑，并寻求同情和帮助。深夜可能会有敌对行动，但不必为此担心。

text.ori_cn: 九三：壮于頄有凶君子夬夬独行遇雨若濡有愠无咎。
text.man_en: The third NINE, undivided, shows its subject (about to advance) with strong (and determined) looks. There will be evil. (But) the superior man, bent on cutting off (the criminal), will walk alone and encounter the rain, (till he be hated by his proper associates) as if he were contaminated (by the others). (In the end) there will be no blame against him.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine three: strong in cheekbone have murder gentleman decisive solo encounter rain if moisten have huffing no blame.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-three: A gentleman who is stronger than his armor will be fierce. If a gentleman walks alone and is wet in the rain, there will be no blame.

text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Elevation: Supreme success through the appearance of a great person, no distress will occur. Auspicious for southern expeditions.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 商 "表示（在其条件下）将取得巨大的进步和成功。以（其所蕴含的品质）求见伟人，其对象无需焦虑。向南方前进将是幸运的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 尚表示（在这种条件下）将会有很大的进步和成功。寻求（其中隐含的品质）与伟人会面，其主体无需焦虑。南进必有幸。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 上卦表示（在其条件下）将会有巨大的进步和成功。以（其中暗示的品质）来寻求与大人物相遇，其主体无需忧虑。向南进取会有幸运。

text.ori_cn: 初六：允升大吉。
text.man_en: The first SIX, divided, shows its subject advancing upwards with the welcome (of those above him). There will be great good fortune.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The sixth day of the sixth month: Yoon Sung Dae Gil.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The sixth day of the lunar month: good fortune.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: First six: Allow ascent, great fortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第一个 "SIX "被分割开来，显示其主体在（上面的）人的欢迎下向上移动。将有巨大的好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 前六个，分开，显示其主题在（他之上的人）的欢迎下向上推进。将会有很大的福气。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初六，分开，显示其主体上升，受到上方的欢迎。大吉大利。

text.ori_cn: 九二：孚乃利用禴无咎。
text.man_en: The second NINE, undivided, shows its subject with that sincerity which will make even the (small) offerings of the vernal sacrifice acceptable. There will be no error.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine two: fu is to make use of the springboard without blame.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-two: Fu Nai takes advantage of Xian Wujiu.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Ninety-two: Faithfulness makes it suitable to employ sacrifice, no blame.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第二个 "九 "是不分割的，它的主题是真诚的，即使是春祭的（小）祭品也是可以接受的。不会有任何错误。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第二个九，完整地，以诚意展示了它的主题，这使得即使是春季祭祀的（小）供品也可以接受。不会有错误。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九二，不恒其德，或承之羞。贞，吉。

text.ori_cn: 九三：升虚邑。
text.man_en: The third NINE, undivided, shows its subject ascending upwards (as into) an empty city.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine-three: ascending to Hollow Eup.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-three: promoted to Xuyi.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Nine in the third place: Ascend to the empty city.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第三个 "九 "是不分割的，表现的是主体向上（如进入）一座空城。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第三个九，未分割，显示其主题向上上升（如进入）一座空城。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 象曰：上九，虚城。

text.ori_cn: 六四：王用亨于岐山吉无咎。
text.man_en: The fourth SIX, divided, shows its subject employed by the king to present his offerings on mount Khi. There will be good fortune; there will be no mistake.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Six Four: Wang Yu Heng in Qishan Ji no blame.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: June 4th: Wang Yongheng was lucky in Qishan.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Sixty-four: Wang Yongheng conducting an offering at Qishan is auspicious and without misfortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第四个 "六 "字被分割开来，显示国王在岐山上献上祭品。吉祥如意，万无一失。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第四个六，分开，显示其主题被国王雇用来在基山上献祭。会有好运；不会有任何错误。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第四爻，阴爻，表示其主体受国王之命在祁山献祭。这预示着吉祥；不会有错。

text.ori_cn: 六五：贞吉升阶。
text.man_en: The fifth SIX, divided, shows its subject firmly correct, and therefore enjoying good fortune. He ascends the stairs (with all due ceremony).
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: VI.5: Chingi ascends the ladder.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-five: Zhenji is promoted.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Six Five: Persistence brings good fortune and promotion.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第五个 "SIX "被分割开来，显示出它的主题非常正确，因此享有好运。他（以应有的仪式）登上楼梯。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第五六分，表明其主题坚定正确，因此享有吉祥。他走上楼梯（带着所有应有的仪式）。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第六爻，离位，显示其主体坚守正道，因此享有好运。他（按礼仪）登上台阶。

text.ori_cn: 上六：冥升利于不息之贞。
text.man_en: The sixth SIX, divided, shows its subject advancing upwards blindly. Advantage will be found in a ceaseless maintenance of firm correctness.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Upper Sixth: Hierarchical Ascension is conducive to uninterrupted chastity.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 6: The ascension of the underworld is conducive to the undying chastity.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Top six: Rising from the dark is advantageous for perseverance without ceasing.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第六个 "SIX"（分割）表示主体盲目地向上推进。不断保持坚定的正确性会带来好处。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第六六，分裂，显示其主题盲目地向上前进。不断保持坚定的正确性将会带来优势。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第六爻，动而上进，昏昧无知。恒持正固，利见大人。

text.ori_cn: §困：亨贞大人吉无咎有言不信。
text.man_en: In (the condition denoted by) Khwan there may (yet be) progress and success. For the firm and correct, the (really) great man, there will be good fortune. He will fall into no error. If he makes speeches, his words cannot be made good.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Sleepy: Heng Ching Lord auspicious no blame for having words to disbelieve.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sleepy: Mr. Hengzhen Ji Wujiu doesn’t believe what he said.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Difficulty: Lord Heng Zhen is fortunate and free from blame, but there are words that are not believed.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在（Khwan 所表示的）条件下，可能（还会）有进步和成功。对于坚定正确、（真正）伟大的人来说，会有好运。他不会犯错。如果他发表言论，他的言辞就不会被善用。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 在Khwan（由Khwan表示的情况）中，可能（仍然）有进步和成功。坚定正确的伟人，会有福报。他不会犯任何错误。如果他发表演讲，他的话就不可能兑现。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在坤卦的状态下，仍可能有进展和成功。对于坚定而正确的（真正）伟人，将会有好运。他不会犯错。如果他发表讲话，他的话将无法实现。

text.ori_cn: 初六：臀困于株木入于幽谷三岁不觌。
text.man_en: The first SIX, divided, shows its subject with bare buttocks straitened under the stump of a tree. He enters a dark valley, and for three years has no prospect (of deliverance).
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The sixth day of the sixth month: the hip is trapped in a plant and enters the valley of the shadow for three years without face to face.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixth day of the lunar month: The buttocks are trapped in the trees and enter the deep valley. At the age of three, there is no face to face.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: First Six: Constraint on the buttocks due to thorny trees, entering a secluded valley, not to be seen for three years.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第一首《SIX》被分割开来，表现的是主人公赤裸的臀部被压在树桩下。他进入了一个黑暗的山谷，三年来一直没有（解脱）的希望。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 前六张被分开，展示了其主题，裸露的臀部紧缩在树桩下。他进入黑暗的山谷，三年没有希望。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初六，臀部赤裸困于树根之下。他进入黑暗的山谷，三年内毫无解脱的希望。

text.ori_cn: 九二：困于酒食朱绂方来利用亨祀征凶无咎。
text.man_en: The second NINE, undivided, shows its subject straitened amidst his wine and viands. There come to him anon the red kneecovers (of the ruler). It will be well for him (to maintain his sincerity as) in sacrificing. Active operations (on his part) will lead to evil, but he will be free from blame.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine two: trapped in wine and food Zhu Sash Fang came to make use of the Heng Sacrifice Legend of Fierce No Blame.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: 92: Trapped in food and drink, Zhu Fu came to use Hengsi to ward off evil without any blame.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Nine in the second place: Trapped by wine and food, the noble comes forward. It is advantageous to conduct sacrifices. Going on an expedition brings misfortune, but there is no blame.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第二幅九宫格没有分割，表现了主人公在美酒佳肴中的窘迫。他马上就会得到（统治者的）红色膝盖套。对他来说，（在祭祀时）保持诚意是件好事。他的积极行动将导致罪恶，但他将免于责罚。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第二个九，完整地显示了它的主题在他的酒和食物中的困境。不久，（统治者的）红色护膝来到了他的面前。牺牲对他来说（保持他的诚意）是有好处的。 （就他而言）积极的行动会导致邪恶，但他不会受到指责。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 六二，坎酒食，得其膝，用无咎，祭祀无咎，行有凶。

text.ori_cn: 六三：困于石据于蒺藜入于其宫不见其妻凶。
text.man_en: The third SIX, divided, shows its subject straitened before a (frowning) rock. He lays hold of thorns. He enters his palace, and does not see his wife. There will be evil.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Sixth three: trapped in the stone according to the Tribulus terrestris into its Palace do not see his wife fierce.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-three: Trapped in stones and held by thorns, he entered his palace but could not see his wife.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Six Three: Trapped by a stone and surrounded by thorns, entering his palace but not seeing his wife, it is ominous.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第三个 "SIX "被分割开来，显示出它的主题在（皱眉的）岩石前受困。他抓住荆棘。他进入自己的宫殿，却看不到妻子。将有邪恶。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第三个“六”，分开，显示其主体被困在一块（皱着眉头的）岩石前。他抓住荆棘。他进入自己的宫殿，却没有看到他的妻子。会有邪恶。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第三爻，初期，显示其主体被一块（皱眉的）石头困住。他抓住荆棘。他进入他的宫殿，却没有看到他的妻子。将有灾祸。

text.ori_cn: 九四：来徐徐困于金车吝有终。
text.man_en: The fourth NINE, undivided, shows its subject proceeding very slowly (to help the subject of the first line), who is straitened by the carriage adorned with metal in front of him. There will be occasion for regret, but the end will be good.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine-four: Come Xu Xu trapped in a golden car stint has an end.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-Four: I will gradually be trapped in the gold car and be stingy in the end.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Nine Four: Steadily approaching, entrapped in a golden carriage, there will be an end to the miserliness.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第四行 "九 "是不分行的，它显示出它的主人公（为了帮助第一行的主人公）走得很慢，他被前面装饰着金属的马车弄得很窘迫。虽然会有遗憾，但结局是美好的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第四个“九”，未分割，显示其主题进展非常缓慢（以帮助第一行的主题），他被前面装饰着金属的马车所束缚。会有遗憾的时候，但结局会是好的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九四，不妖，其匪由速，其昏未明，凶用有悔，吉者所以终也。

text.ori_cn: 九五：劓刖困于赤绂乃徐有说利用祭祀。
text.man_en: The fifth NINE, undivided, shows its subject with his nose and feet cut off. He is straitened by (his ministers in their) scarlet aprons. He is leisurely in his movements, however, and is satisfied. It will be well for him to be (as sincere) as in sacrificing (to spiritual beings).
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine five: wakes and amputations are trapped in the red sash Nai Xu has said to make use of the sacrifice.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-five: Xu Youshuo used sacrifices when he was trapped in Chi Fu.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: In the ninety-fifth year: Mutilated and bound in red robes, he gradually found favor, proving useful for sacrifices.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第五个九宫格是不分割的，画面上的主人公被割去了鼻子和双脚。他被（身着猩红围裙的大臣们）所束缚。不过，他的动作从容不迫，而且很满意。他应该（像祭祀神灵一样）诚心诚意。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第五个九，未分割，展示了其鼻子和脚被切断的主体。他被（他的部长们穿着）猩红色的围裙弄得手足无措。不过他的动作却很从容，也很满足。对他来说，在（对精神存在）进行牺牲（同样真诚）是件好事。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九五，刲鼻剔趾，无咎。帛桎之睽，履得其宜，休复也。弗尚匹夫，咎祸不作。

text.ori_cn: 上六：困于葛藟于臲卼曰动悔有悔征吉。
text.man_en: The sixth SIX, divided, shows its subject straitened, as if bound with creepers; or in a high and dangerous position, and saying (to himself), ‘If I move, I shall repent it. ' If he does repent of former errors, there will be good fortune in his going forward.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: On the sixth: trapped in Ge bramble in tottering king is said to move repentance there is repentance signs auspicious.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Chapter 6: Trapped in Ge Shen and Neng Mi, he said that if you move, you will regret it, and you will regret it, and you will be lucky.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Sixth line: Trapped amid the creeping ivy, in a state of instability; it is said that moving will bring regret, yet persistence brings fortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第六个 "六 "是 "分"，它显示了它的主题被束缚，就像被爬山虎捆绑着一样；或者处于一个高而危险的位置，并（对自己）说：'如果我动了，我就会悔恨。'如果他确实悔改了以前的错误，那么他前进的道路上就会有好运。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第六个“六”，分开，显示其主题狭窄，仿佛被爬行者束缚；或在高而危险的位置上，（自言自语）说：‘如果我动了，我就会后悔。 ’如果他能悔改以前的错误，他的未来就会有福报。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第六爻，动则凶，如被蔓缚；在高而险之处，自言“动则悔”。若能悔其前错，进则有吉。

text.ori_cn: §井：改邑不改井无丧无得往来井井汔至亦未繘井羸其瓶凶。
text.man_en: (Looking at) Ching, (we think of) how (the site of) a town may be changed, while (the fashion of) its wells undergoes no change. (The water of a well) never disappears and never receives (any great) increase, and those who come and those who go can draw and enjoy the benefit. If (the drawing) have nearly been accomplished, but, before the rope has quite reached the water, the bucket is broken, this is evil.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Wells: change the Euphrates do not change the wells no funeral no get to travel to the wells wells carries to also not a well-rope wells won its bottle fierce.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Well: If you change the city and don’t change the well, there will be no mourning and no access to the well. If the well is too busy and the well is not opened, the bottle will be unlucky.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Well: Changing the town without altering the well, nothing is lost or gained. Coming and going orderly at the well. As it is drawn to the limit, it is not yet unfit for drawing, the jug is shattered—misfortune.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: (看着）"井"，（我们会想到）一个城镇的（选址）可以改变，而它的水井的（样式）却不会改变。(井水）永远不会消失，也永远不会（大量）增加，来的人和去的人都能汲取，都能享受到好处。如果（汲水）已接近完成，但绳子还没有完全到达水里，水桶就破了，这就是坏事。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: （看）Ching，（我们想到）一个城镇（的地点）可能会改变，而它的井（的时尚）却没有改变。 （井水）不绝，不增，来者去者皆可汲取之利。若已近成，绳尚未入水，桶已破，此是恶。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: （看着）井，（我们想到）城镇可以变迁，然而（它的井）却始终不变。（井水）从不消失，也不会（有显著的）增加，来来往往的人们都能取水并受益。如果（汲水）快要完成，但在绳子还没有完全到达水面之前，桶就破了，这是不好的征兆。

text.ori_cn: 初六：井泥不食旧井无禽。
text.man_en: The first SIX, divided, shows a well so muddy that men will not drink of it; or an old well to which neither birds (nor other creatures) resort.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The sixth day of the sixth month: no food from the mud of the well, no fowl from the old well.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixth day of the lunar month: If there is no mud in the well, there will be no birds in the old well.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: First Yin: The well is muddy and cannot be drank from; the old well has no birds.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第一个 "SIX "被分割开来，显示的是一口浑浊得让人无法饮用的井；或者是一口鸟类（或其他生物）都不愿意饮用的老井。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 前六个，分开，显示出一口泥泞的井，人们不会喝它；或一口老井，鸟类（或其他生物）都不会去那里。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 初六，井泥不食，旧井无禽放。

text.ori_cn: 九二：井谷射鲋瓮敝漏。
text.man_en: The second NINE, undivided, shows a well from which by a hole the water escapes and flows away to the shrimps (and such small creatures among the grass), or one the water of which leaks away from a broken basket.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Ninety-two: The Well Valley shoots perch and the urn leaks.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-two: The well is shot and the urn is leaking.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Ninety-two: In a well-valley, shooting fish, the jar is broken and leaks.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第二个 "九 "是不分割的，表现的是一口井，井水从一个洞中流出，流向小虾（以及草丛中的这些小动物），或者是一个破篮子漏出的水。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第二个“九”，未分开，显示了一口井，水从一个洞中逸出并流向虾（以及草丛中的此类小生物），或者其中的水从破损的篮子中漏出。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 第二个九，未分裂的，显示出一口井，其水通过一个洞流走，流向小虾和草中的小生物，或者其水从一个破碎的篮子中漏掉。

text.ori_cn: 九三：井渫不食为我心恻可用汲王明并受其福。
text.man_en: The third NINE, undivided, shows a well, which has been cleared out, but is not used. Our hearts are sorry for this, for the water might be drawn out and used. If the king were (only) intelligent, both he and we might receive the benefit of it.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Nine-three: The well dredge is not food for my heart compassionate available to draw Wang Ming and receive its blessings.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Ninety-three: If I don’t eat from the well, I can show my compassion to the king and receive his blessings.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Nine three: The well is cleaned yet not used for drinking, causing sorrow in my heart. It can be drawn on; the king's brightness will be received and his blessings enjoyed.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第三个 "九"，没有分割，显示的是一口井，井水已经被清理出来，但没有被使用。我们为此感到惋惜，因为这些水本可以被汲取利用。如果国王有智慧，他和我们都能从中受益。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第三个“九”，未分割，显示一口井，已被清理，但未使用。我们的心为此感到遗憾，因为水可能会被抽出来并被使用。如果国王（仅）聪明，他和我们都可能从中受益。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 九三，井洌，寒泉食。用汲，王猶所以悔。我中心有所憾耳。

text.ori_cn: 六四：井甃无咎。
text.man_en: The fourth SIX, divided, shows a well, the lining of which is well laid. There will be no error.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Six Four: Well Charlotte is not to blame.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Sixty-four: There is no fault in the well.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Six in the fourth place: There is no blame in the well-curbing.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 第四个 "SIX "被分割，表示一口井，井的内衬铺设得很好。不会出错。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 第四个“六”，分开，显示一口井，其衬里铺设良好。不会有错误。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 上六，井收勿幕，无咎。

text.ori_cn: 九五：井冽寒泉食。
